title: NA
body: I'd like to clarify Thomas' point. In a data item, the content is shown as-is. But in a dynamic text item or text item, the content is HTML by default (unless you explicitly define it as plain text), so a line-break character is handled like any other white-space character, so the output should be `Hello, world` (but not `Hello,world`).

title: XLSX Emitter "Cannot add merged region" - again
body:
I hoped my issue would be resolved with the fix for #1455, unfortunately it wasn't. So I have boiled it down to a simple report to reproduce my problem in 4.15:
[excel_cell_merge.rptdesign.txt](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/files/14883584/excel_cell_merge.rptdesign.txt)
In the report I already set the mentioned user property "ExcelEmitter.RemoveBlankRows" to false.

On creation of this report I get the following error:
```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot add merged region A4:A8 to sheet because it overlaps with an existing merged region (A4:C4).
	at org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet.validateMergedRegions(XSSFSheet.java:429)
	at org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet.addMergedRegion(XSSFSheet.java:349)
	at org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet.addMergedRegion(XSSFSheet.java:303)
	at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.StyleManagerUtils.extendRows(StyleManagerUtils.java:1263)
	at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.handlers.AbstractRealTableRowHandler.interruptRow(AbstractRealTableRowHandler.java:233)
	at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.handlers.AbstractRealTableRowHandler.endRow(AbstractRealTableRowHandler.java:80)
	at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.ExcelEmitter.endRow(ExcelEmitter.java:409)
```

The source of the error is the dynamic text wiht HTML content in the last row of the grid (a text element containing HTML creates the same error):
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/22446825/08f71067-72f7-459f-9611-f67860d3af9d)
FYI: in my productive report the HTML formatted data is read from a data set. The provided example report doesn't do this for simplicity and portability.

When I put this element outside the grid, the XLSX is rendered successfully and looks like this:
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/22446825/079d7410-003e-4798-ad2d-d0ae8a58997b)

By seeing the result of the successful I assume the XLSX emitter runs into the problem, because it tries to create a new column for the bullet points inside the merged grid cell.

When I change the report and split the last row to 3 cells instead of the merged one like this
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/22446825/dab57b77-25fe-4f09-8ada-a8112423d941)
the XLSX emitter creates the following output, which looks fine to me:
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/22446825/e742907a-1612-43c6-9d88-e0d2c03d2913)

So, if everything worked well, I would like to see this as result of the rendered report:
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/22446825/d6a5448a-8a73-40a5-9ca8-494cda5d4af0)
The content of the dynamic text element as a big, single text in a merged cell over 3 columns.

title: NA
body:
> By seeing the result of the successful I assume the XLSX emitter runs into the problem, because it tries to create a new column for the bullet points inside the merged grid cell.

I think you are right here.

Probably the cell-merging cannot work with HTML content that creates a grid-like structure, in this case due to the bullet points.

BIRT is not perfect.
Support for HTML and CSS varies depending on the emitter.
In particular, you should not expect full support for LI or UL or TABLE structures.

One possible workaround (depending on the complexity of the HTML) could be to create a scripted data set which parses the text into lines, returning something like INDENT, BULLET, TEXT and then use a table item bound to this scripted data set inside your merged cell to render the line one after the other.

title: NA
body:
Yeah, but interestingly BIRT is able to create a nice output in the not merged context. So I don't quite understand why it doesn't merge the cell and then does the same thing with the dynamic text as in the non merged cell. In my opinion the splitting of the content should be done always or never and not if it is in a merged cell or not.

But you are right: in some case you would need to simplify the HTML or find other ways...

title: NA
body:
> In my opinion the splitting of the content should be done always or never and not if it is in a merged cell or not.

I think this is basically what's happening, but this conflicts with the merged cell.

title: NA
body:
I disagree.
As my tests above show, it makes a difference in which context the dynamic text element is located, so we don't have consistent behaviour.

1. Non-merged cell:
HTML content complete in single cell.

2. Outside the grid:
HTML content is automatically split into individual rows and columns.

3. Inside the merged cell:
It breaks, presumably trying to do the same thing as in 2.

So we have at least 2 different behaviours for the same HTML content...

I cannot be completely sure which would be best for most use cases, but I think I would prefer variant 1. 
If I put an element in a cell in the design, I would expect it to be in a cell in the output, since the whole report design works that way in general, and not by adding more columns and rows "at random"...

title: NA
body:
The problem is that your logic isn't the BIRT logic because leading is the wrapping element and not the content of the last leaf-element.
So because each behavior has to be implement the "inherited"-behavior and this is from root to leaf.
Therefore each element has his own implementation.

You "dynamic text" is special because you use an "unsorted list" and this will be handle in a grid or table like an table in a table cell. Of course there i a special handling of nested tables at cell level, therefore you can see the data on grid. 
As a single element we haven't any problem because it will be generated/handled like a kind of special table, therefore the own rows.

The version with the "dynamic text" into a grid with merged cell is the special version of a special version because then you have all. A nested tabled into a merged cell. The handling is complex at this moment and there are more constellation which can get such merge topic.

It needs a while to analyse your case and there is no guaranty that it will handle all cases because at the end this is not possible (for us).

title: Performance Bottleneck
NA
body:
Hmm, I don't think changing the type to a `LinkedList` instead of `ArrayList` would help. In both cases removing elements takes _O(n)_.
Shouldn't it be a `HashMap` or something like that instead?

If you are profiling anyway, it would also be interesting to see the average element count of the structure.

Maybe the size is more of a problem. Looking at the code, it seems to me that registering/deregistering only takes place in the methods of `DataSourceQuery` class.

Maybe there is some kind of _memory leak_ like forgetting to call `deregister` somehow or delaying the call too long? That would cause the structure to grow and grow, if a big report uses several thousands or millions of queries. (Well, with a classical remote RDBMS, such a report would be a candidate for refactoring anyway, because it'd run forever and slow the DB down)

Because otherwise I cannot understand why a few (or a few dozens) queries which are open at the same time can cause the structure to grow to a significant size _n_.

title: NA
body:
Yes, I confirm the idea of Henning. I have also some reports which use many queries in combination with loops and with large row count (1Mio.) but I have never seen this problem.

Do you got the problem with the latest BIRT version 4.15?

title: NA
body:
There was indeed a memory leak. In ```DataSourceQuery#execute``` elements were added but never removed.
Also there was a unnecessary big syncronized block.

I agree that this report needs a redesign, but it is not that easy to be done.
I am using Birt 4.12.0 but it seems to be ancient problem

title: Excel, add corresponding options of "display grindlines" and "display row-column header" for print out
body:
Currently the excel emitter support the display of grindlines and the display of the row-column headings.
The apache poi library supports the corresponding options to control the print options of these.
Additional the options to set the "page fit" for printing and the "zoom"-option of excel should be added as user property.

The following user properties will be added:
- ExcelEmitter.PrintGridlines
- ExcelEmitter.PrintRowColHeadings
- ExcelEmitter.PrintFitToPage
- ExcelEmitter.DisplaySheetZoom

The options will be added on the same elements like e.g. "ExcelEmitter.DisplayGrindlines":
- page
- table
- list

title: NA
body: The PR is merged to the master.

title: Excel, add the options "excel page layout"- or "excel page break"-preview
body:
Excel provides 3 standard options in which kind an excel sheet will be displayed.
The 3 kind of preview are "Normal", "Page Break Layout" and "Page Layout".
The 2 layout options should be available like new user property **"ExcelEmitter.PagePreview"**.
The property will support the 2 optons with the values
- **"PageLayout"**, display the page layout preview
- **"PageBreak"**, display the page break preview

This requirement was also mentioned in some BIRT-discussions.

Source example:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7861001/set-page-view-mode-in-excel-file-using-apache-poi

title: NA
body: The change is merged to the master branch.

title: NA
body:
@speckyspooky 

If you do  Help -> Perform Setup Tasks... you will update the target platform and see this problem.

The problem is a result of this commit:

https://github.com/eclipse/gef-classic/commit/451bc1fff9a904b7e303c5747d05989b738d1c70

Which is for this issue:

https://github.com/eclipse/gef-classic/issues/418

It happens here:

org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.editors.rulers.EditorGuideEditPart.updateLocationOfFigures(int)

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/208716/e6951391-3415-4687-89f9-063590235d54)

Apparently that should now be a Rectangle, but I have no idea the design intent here in BIRT, i.e., how to convert the position to a rectangle.

@azoitl  @ptziegler

I'm not sure this new exception throwing is okay.  The API being called has no constraint on the constraint:

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/208716/ff3e7980-4217-4a42-9a80-6f3f0d55a7a4)

Here are other places it's called by BIRT:

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/208716/29a60859-9f58-472f-8f1f-7e13550e4200)

Probably the x-ed out one is the only bogus one...

@speckyspooky 

Commenting out that line seems to fix the problem; maybe this never did anything and was always just quietly ignore.

title: NA
NA
body: FYI, I'm traveling this week so my connectivity will be spotty at best.

title: NA
body:
The EditorRulerEditorPart (or the EditorRulerFigure, to be more specific) is using the [EditorRulerLayout](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/blob/master/UI/org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui/src/org/eclipse/birt/report/designer/internal/ui/editors/rulers/EditorRulerLayout.java), which extends the XYLayout.

Because it overwrites the `layout`, method, everything works at runtime, even when integers are used as constraint. But by doing so, it violates the contract specified in the JavaDoc of `setConstraint`, which is what's leading to the error mentioned above.

```
/**
 * Sets the layout constraint of the given figure. The constraints can only be
 * of type {@link Rectangle}.
 *
 * @see LayoutManager#setConstraint(IFigure, Object)
 * @since 2.0
 */
```

title: NA
body:
Given that I can't predict how many other applications might be doing something similar, it probably makes sense to simply log an error/warning, rather than throwing an exception. This way clients still get feedback that something fishy is going on, without immediately breaking the editor.

@azoitl wdyt?

title: NA
body:
@ptziegler  Given the legacy that is out I think this is a better solution. I also had a look what we could do to make the live for our users easier. Because I still strongly think that BIRT should not have used `XYLayout` here. One problem I noted is that all the GEF Classic ruler stuff is internal. Which is bad because my initial suggestion would have been to inherit from GEF Classics` RulerLayout`. But at that point I can not grasp the implication of making some of the ruler stuff API.

One thing that we can do for people that are doing similar things is to introduce a new `AbstractConstraintLayout`, where we move the constraint handling stuff from `XYLayout` and `RulerLayout`.

title: NA
body:
> One problem I noted is that all the GEF Classic ruler stuff is internal.

My impression is that BIRT effectively copy-pasted the RulerLayout class to avoid exactly this problem. Which is why the EditorRulerLayout extends XYLayout, as this also used to be the case for the original class.

> One thing that we can do for people that are doing similar things is to introduce a new AbstractConstraintLayout, where we move the constraint handling stuff from XYLayout and RulerLayout.

Makes sense to me.

title: NA
body: With this [GEF Classic PR](https://github.com/eclipse/gef-classic/pull/438) the quickest and most correct fix is to change the parent class of `EditorRulerLayout` to `AbstractConstraintLayout`.

title: NA
body:
In addition, I've also created https://github.com/eclipse/gef-classic/pull/440, which fixes this problem without the need to adapt BIRT.

Instead of throwing an exception, the layouts now simply create a warning and add them to the error log.
![image](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/70652978/9586b6ff-fa0d-49f9-872e-7a0cff6396a2)

title: NA
body:
I'm switching the target platform to the nightly build:

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/pull/1676

Indeed it only logs now.  What should be properly do to actually fix the problem?  I don't understand what the constraint's purpose is in the BIRT usage....

title: NA
body:
> What should be properly do to actually fix the problem? 

Instead of extending the `XYLayout`, the EditorRulerLayout should instead extend the `AbstractConstraintLayout`.

title: NA
body:
I have retested 2 things:
**- 1st test:** latest version with the fixes on GEF without an change on BIRT
**- 2nd, test:** change BIRT, the EditorRulerLayout extend the AbstractConstraintLayout (below chang screen)
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/3dbf2ebb-b10c-4ddd-a213-dd1ec714d2a6)

The result is in both cases the same. The good thing is the designer is running.
And in both cases the same warnings will be thrown on the "error log"-page.

But I thought with the move to the AbstractConstraintLayout we will fix the warnings too.

![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/d7360e25-ca6b-4666-9dd0-45e2769a5230)

title: NA
NA
body:
Yes, I saw same classes on my debug session some minutes ago.
I will directly test your hints. Thanks for that!

title: NA
body:
Summary of the 3 extended changes and I agree to solve all topics there is more to after the replacement:
 
EditorRulerLayout
- changed from XYLayout to AbstractConstraintLayout
- missing methods: none

TableLayout
- changed from XYLayout to AbstractConstraintLayout
- missing methods: calculatePreferredSize(IFigure f, int wHint, int hHint)

TableXYLayoutEditPolicy
- changed from XYLayoutEditPolicy to ConstrainedLayoutEditPolicy
- missing methods: getConstraintFor(Point), getConstraintFor(Rectanlge)
- existing methods not defined:	setXyLayout(layout), is given in XYLayoutEditPolicy

title: NA
body:
> TableLayout
> - changed from XYLayout to AbstractConstraintLayout
> - missing methods: calculatePreferredSize(IFigure f, int wHint, int hHint)

TableLayout already has a method called `calculateMinimumSize()`. My naïve approach would've been to simply rename it to `calculatePreferredSize()`. The method from XYLayout couldn't have been called before, given that it would've caused a CCE, so it shouldn't cause any undesirable side effects.

> TableXYLayoutEditPolicy
> - changed from XYLayoutEditPolicy to ConstrainedLayoutEditPolicy
> - missing methods: getConstraintFor(Point), getConstraintFor(Rectanlge)
> - existing methods not defined: setXyLayout(layout), is given in XYLayoutEditPolicy

From what I understand, this edit policy is only used to handle resizing the table cells. It's probably fine to leave them as dummy implementations (similar to most of the other methods).

title: NA
body:
I have created a first PR #1678 and added the missing methods accordingly the original sources to avoid behavior changes.
The warnings are not longer listed :o)

My be we can change these according to your suggestion as dummy-methods but it is the first time that I'm so deep into the designer-engine level and therefore the pesimistic implementation of the copied methods.

@merks What do you think about it?

title: Excel & Indent: implementation of the "indent"-option for excel output
body:
The current implementation of the excel-emitter doesn't support the usage of the excel formatting option of text-indent.
In the most cases addition blank columns were added to get the effect of an indent which increase the report structure and isn't really the best way to handle (simulate) the excel-indent.

The Apache POI library support the method "setIndention()" to set the indent for an excel-cell.

The target of the enhancement will be to add the indent-method and the spacing should be calculated based on the margin- & padding-spacing of the content element and also the cell-padding should be used to calculate the indent in full.

This would be a bigger change of the behavior for the excel output. Therefore I will implements an UserProperty to deactivate the indent setting with the name "ExcelEmitter.DisplayTextIndent" (default: true).

I will create a PR for this enhancement.

title: An "end" is missing to close the "begin" in Postscript emitter
body:
We have been using BIRT in OSGI mode for several years in our project, and we noticed that the header.ps file present in the "emitter.postscript" library contained an error: an "end" was missing to correctly close a "begin".

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/blob/dca18950145a0271bff47fa9522ac9e0203556a6/engine/org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.postscript/src/org/eclipse/birt/report/engine/emitter/postscript/header.ps#L140

We apply the correction directly to our project by unzipping the .jar file "org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.postscript", and modifying the "header.ps" file.

Is it possible to integrate the correction into the next version of BIRT?

Thanks.

![report format2](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/24585849/2c62c2f9-7524-4ced-9451-082c43f704c6)

title: NA
body: I think folks need a way to reproduce the problem---a small sample report---rather than a screenshot of a problem.  (It seems strange to me (not having a clue about any of the details mind you) that the value is of type String rather than some numeric type for which numeric formatting would be applicable.

title: NA
body:
Please download the sample RPT Design and sample excel file from our OneDrive link

https://levantaretechnology-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/senthild_levantare_co_in/EY-T-vTrgiBImYnO6VxV7G4Bdd77ANL4ejBMUJ91LVOq_Q?e=mfcwmR

title: NA
body:
Without looking at the rptdesign (just the screenshot), I think it cannot make sense to use the `SUM` aggregate function with a data type of `String`. **Implicit type conversion** is happening then (I bet), which is the root of many programming problems.

If you want to calculate something, you need a number data type (in your case, `Decimal`).
Then you can apply number formatting for the data item in the layout.

However, the aggregation uses use `double` internally, which may cause additional conversion errors (that is another issue which is discussed in the comments of #1089) 

In fact, when I develop invoice reports or similar reports where correct rounding and number formatting is really important, I do not use BIRT to calculate or format any numbers. Instead, I perform all the calculations and formatting at the SQL level.

title: NA
body:
This topic is not a problem of BIRT this is a topic of the requirement solution of the report-developer.
The first thing is that you use at the same time in your report "number" and "string:minus".
This is a problem if the sum will try to calulcat a number with a string => exception.

The best way would be that you use a aggregation function based on ytpe "float" and use the number format.
And you add a second element to display a "minus" if needed both ypu can control with the visbibility condition.

But currently you try to much things at the same time.

Additional on it I don't know why you try to use at script level every time to convert the value to a string format.
Because the value will be re-casted internally for the aggregation formula of SUM.

title: NA
body:
We've hit a snag in our reporting system regarding data formatting. We've established a rule: if the column value is "number_format_flg='L'", the number should be formatted in lakhs like #,##,##,###.00. Otherwise, it should follow the pattern ###,###,###.00. This rule works smoothly for individual rows when the data type is set as string. However, during data aggregation, the formatting isn't applied as expected.

As suggested by you, even after experimenting with setting the data type as numeric without any specific conditions on the column, the aggregate values persist in the ###,###,###.00 million format.

We're on the lookout for a solution where both individual row and aggregate value formatting adhere to the column value. For reference, we've included the RPT design and data Excel files in the provided link. Any further clarification needed is welcome. Your assistance in resolving this issue would be immensely valued.
**Refer the screenshot for format issues**
![birt format](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/24585849/947f4019-b4a0-4e0e-b271-b33057a91f87)


https://levantaretechnology-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/senthild_levantare_co_in/EY-T-vTrgiBImYnO6VxV7G4Bdd77ANL4ejBMUJ91LVOq_Q?e=mfcwmR

title: NA
body:
Here we have a combination of 2 things.
The first thing is that the "lakhs" format isn't correctly supported due to internal number format usage of the original java number format. I have changed it to the better library with PR #1708

The second thing is really that you mixed up the stuff of the total in one aggregation field.
Currently without the PR you can try to create 2 total line one for US- and one for IN-format and control it with the visibility condition.

With the fix you will be able to use a script at the onCreate method to format the values:
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/116d0e0f-6e92-4221-b828-1fa130177d12)

title: NA
body: The fix is merged to the master branch.

title: ECMAScript 6, additional change to improve the "syntax highlighting" (based on 1574)
body:
The "syntax highlighting" becomes an improvement in addition to the change of #1574.
So the editor screen of JavaScript will get additional commant for the highlighting
and also the listed JavaScript-functions at the script-builder will be changed to list more available functions.

The new option of String-multiline will be marked like the current strings "blue" colored.

The following new key words will be highlighted:
- of
- Packages
- importPackage

The following functions will be highlighted (ROM will be changed):

- Array | includes(searchvalue)
- Array | includes(searchvalue, start)
- String | at(index)
- String | codePointAt(position)
- String | includes(searchvalue)
- String | endsWith(value)
- String | startsWith(value)
- String | repeat(copies)
- String | replaceAll(RegExp, replacement)
- String | padEnd(length, value)
- String | padStart(length, value)
- String | trim()
- String | trimEnd()
- String | trimStart()

Example screen of the changes:

![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/2634027d-7a9a-43ac-9ed4-d6ef4ed7370e)

title: NA
body: The change #1685 is merged to the BIRT-master.

title: Excel, error on file opening when large column-width used at tables-/grid-definition
body:
If a report contains a table or grid with a huge column-width and the user create an excel file then an error appears at the moment of file opening. A message will be displayed that there is an issue and excel will start a fxing of it.
But at the end it could be that data will be lost.

Excel message - part 01
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/c8ef2eeb-80ac-461e-9703-155f13063457)

Excel message - part 02
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/750bcea7-29d0-4c7f-a290-eb2306319ff8)

**Reason:**
The problem is caused on the calculation of the column with of excel.
At a specific moment the number type "short" is used and it gives a number overflow (from positiv to negativ, number circle).

I will populate a PR for that.

title: NA
body: The fix is merged to the BIRT-master.

And some of the most used data types like Oracle number, varchar2.

title: Sorting Column Bindings
body:
When selecting an Available Column Binding in an expression builder, for some reason, "Edit Bindings..." and "RowNum" are being sorting alphabetically also:

![Edit Bindings](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/167772501/2a261825-acf2-4ff2-9b69-7c39c7269fe1)

In older versions, these options were always in the bottom. Could you take a look at this?

title: NA
body:
Your mentioned behavior/sorting was changed from BIRT 4.6 to BIRT 4.8. This change is more like 10years ago.
From my point of view this isn't a bug.

You are welcome to change the behavior.

title: NA
body:
The change was done on Feb 8, 2017 with commit 4403ba0

The topic is according to the description that 3 new "ViewerComparator" was set to each of the expression builder views
also to the 3rd VIew `functionTable.setComparator( new ViewerComparator( ) );`
But with the 3rd comparator the original sorting order and the functionality of the sort-button was lost.

I will provide a PR to fix it.

title: NA
body: The fix is merged into the master branch.

title: Enhance the SQL-DataSet-Editor with a search option - see #1584
body:
In the past I programmed lot of SQL-statements which are very long.
Some of my statements have mor like 1.000 lines of code for MS SQL Server.
Also some of my Oracle-statements are very complex and long.

The master development will be done on MS SQL Studio or the SQL-developer.
But in special cases it would be very helpful to have a search option of query text directly on the SQL-DataSetEditor.

The topic is that the standard "Find/Replace"-dialog are not available on the source-viewer-editor which is the core component of the SQL-editor.
To get the search option I would prefer to add directly a search option into the wizard with forward-/backward-serach
and with the standard option of case-sensitive- & whole-word-search.


### For this change a created a small PoC for the SQLDataSet-editor

**1. Screen, search first text**
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/95b2f6f9-4ad8-4640-a020-1ed7c131b249)

**2. Screen, forward search**
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/538c2171-9653-42dc-8a23-ccc46d3758bc)

**3. Screen, forward search end, with message**
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/3eb201a4-b662-48cf-82a5-b564c2afc190)

**4. Screen, backward search end, with message**
![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/87a1d4ca-124a-42ac-9cc0-a3864cbef02b)

title: NA
body: @wimjongman @hvbtup @merks your vote is welcome before I create a PR for this change.

BTW, I'm not sure if the new refactor find/replace infrastructure might be useful or reusable for this purpose.

https://github.com/eclipse-platform/eclipse.platform.ui/pull/1192

Thanks for your vote :o)

Parallel I will show your link to the new version. I saw that the new version is really very new.
So I hope we can to in further steps a kind of improvements to have the first step with the search above
and if the new dialog is usable on this WizardDialog-level we can optimize it.

title: NA
body: @merks the goal is to later provide an interface for all Views to implement so that the overlay can target them. It is alreay possible to implement IFindReplaceTarget and IFindReplaceTargetExtension1..4 in order for the FindReplaceDialog to correctly open and target the view for searching. I strongly vote for using this existing mechanism instead of remaking a new Find/Replace-Mechanism, unless there is no other way. Feel free to reach out in case further questions arise.

title: NA
body:
@Wittmaxi
Good to hear that all views will get the option for the Find/Replace-Mechanism.
I will not implement a new way, it is a small helper to solve the biggest pain to find query text on large statements.

So if your interface-implementation is done, I would replace my stuff of the simple search with your better version.
Do you have a time schedule for the interface so that we can use the new overlay?

title: NA
body:
In order to simplify the transition, your own implementation could look like this:

- Your editor implements IFindReplaceTarget and the required extensions
- Your UI only accesses the editor using these interfaces
alternatively, you don't even build your own ui but rather just ipen the FindReplaceDialog with your editor as target

There is no concrete timeline and I cannot make any commitments about dates currently. But I will be working on it as soon as the Overlay for the editor is working decently well (in fact, I already have a prototype done which allows the Problems View to use the same overlay!)

title: NA
body:
Yes, I have extended a new class from the SourceViewer and there I use the **IFindReplaceTarget** to find the entered search text.
The UI elements are only to control the find options and navigate forward/backward.

So it will be easy to reimplements based on it your overlay.
Let my know when it would be possible to integrate your overlay.

title: NA
body: The change is merged to the master branch.

title: BIRT 4.15 can't be used under Eclipse RAP
body:
We have an Eclipse RAP application with BIRT embedded. Our current embedded BIRT version is 4.9. When trying to upgrade to BIRT  4.15 we are running into a plug-in dependency issue. 
org.eclise.birt.report.engine
--> Import-Package: org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry
     --> Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.swt
The bundle org.eclipse.swt does not exist in the Eclipse RAP environment therefore it seems we cannot upgrade.

title: NA
body:
This was done very recently:

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/commit/3437eb34c9a07419af251965559fe294b7328eee

I see these bundle imports:

![image](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/208716/d0e2dd88-8f23-4749-b067-0a98b2b96129)

Those appear to have been there since 2006.

I suppose those could use package imports (except for the re-export would be problematic).

You could contribute:

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt?tab=readme-ov-file#create-a-birt-development-environment

title: NA
body: Great, so we should just wait for the next BIRT release as the commit fixes the problem. We don't use org.eclipse.birt.ui in our application as we only require the report engine not the designer.

title: NA
body:
I would **strongly** suggest testing version 4.16:

https://download.eclipse.org/birt/updates/nightly/latest

Because if there is a problem it can be fixed for the 4.16 release in June, but if you wait until after next release, any subsequent changes will have to wait for the 4.17 release in September.

So I'll assume the problem is addressed and you will reopen if there is some other problem.

title: NA
body: Thank you, I have confirmed that the dependency issue is resolved for us in the latest BIRT build.

title: Can't generate Excel file: Could not auto-size column. Make sure the column was tracked prior to auto-sizing the column.
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/discussions/1688
Originally posted by **p-schmidiger** May 16, 2024 We want to upgrade from BIRT 4.14.0 to BIRT 4.15.0. Now, while testing, we noticed that we cannot generate Excel reports. The preview of an Excel report no longer works in the Birt Designer either. I added my sample report: [WhiteSpaceTestReport.zip](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/files/15332567/WhiteSpaceTestReport.zip) We received the following error message: Caused by: org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.EngineException: Error happened while running the report. at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.EngineTask.handleFatalExceptions(EngineTask.java:1867) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RunAndRenderTask.doRun(RunAndRenderTask.java:153) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RunAndRenderTask.run(RunAndRenderTask.java:69) ... 58 more Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Could not auto-size column. Make sure the column was tracked prior to auto-sizing the column. at org.apache.poi.xssf.streaming.SXSSFSheet.autoSizeColumn(SXSSFSheet.java:1639) at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.handlers.AbstractRealTableHandler.endTable(AbstractRealTableHandler.java:181) at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.handlers.TopLevelTableHandler.endTable(TopLevelTableHandler.java:62) at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.ExcelEmitter.endTable(ExcelEmitter.java:381) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.CompositeContentEmitter.endTable(CompositeContentEmitter.java:175) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLTableLayoutEmitter.endTable(HTMLTableLayoutEmitter.java:368) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.ContentEmitterUtil.endContent(ContentEmitterUtil.java:101) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.AbstractNode.end(AbstractNode.java:65) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.HTMLPageBuffer._endContainer(HTMLPageBuffer.java:141) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.HTMLPageBuffer.endContainer(HTMLPageBuffer.java:131) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.TableBreakBuffer.endContainer(TableBreakBuffer.java:257) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLTableLM.end(HTMLTableLM.java:49) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLAbstractLM.layout(HTMLAbstractLM.java:134) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLBlockStackingLM.layoutNodes(HTMLBlockStackingLM.java:66) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLPageLM.layout(HTMLPageLM.java:92) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLReportLayoutEngine.layout(HTMLReportLayoutEngine.java:97) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RunAndRenderTask.doRun(RunAndRenderTask.java:145) ... 60 more Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot get best fit column width on untracked column 0. Either explicitly track the column or track all columns. at org.apache.poi.xssf.streaming.AutoSizeColumnTracker.getBestFitColumnWidth(AutoSizeColumnTracker.java:283) at org.apache.poi.xssf.streaming.SXSSFSheet.autoSizeColumn(SXSSFSheet.java:1636) ... 76 more Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Column was never explicitly tracked and isAllColumnsTracked() is false (trackAllColumns() was never called or untrackAllColumns() was called after trackAllColumns() was called). at org.apache.poi.xssf.streaming.AutoSizeColumnTracker.getBestFitColumnWidth(AutoSizeColumnTracker.java:280) ... 77 more

title: NA
body:
This problem occurs when generating the Excel using the streaming-option `ExcelEmitter.StreamingXlsx`. In the documentation for the SXSSFSheet https://poi.apache.org/apidocs/dev/org/apache/poi/xssf/streaming/SXSSFSheet.html#autoSizeColumn-int-boolean- is says the following:

> Special note about SXSSF implementation: You must register the columns you wish to track with the SXSSFSheet using [trackColumnForAutoSizing(int)](https://poi.apache.org/apidocs/dev/org/apache/poi/xssf/streaming/SXSSFSheet.html#trackColumnForAutoSizing-int-) or [trackAllColumnsForAutoSizing()](https://poi.apache.org/apidocs/dev/org/apache/poi/xssf/streaming/SXSSFSheet.html#trackAllColumnsForAutoSizing--). This is needed because the rows needed to compute the column width may have fallen outside the random access window and been flushed to disk. Tracking columns is required even if all rows are in the random access window.

Since the columns are not registered for tracking first, aforementioned error is thrown when autosizing the columns.

Sadly, tracking comes with a performance penalty.
> Because determining the best-fit width for a cell is expensive, this may affect the performance.

Therefore, I suggest to just stop autosize the columns when having the streaming-option `ExcelEmitter.StreamingXlsx` enabled.

I will make a pull-request for that.

I took a look into the stacktrace and on the source code.
But I can only see that the query of your report was started and then an error occur according to your messages here:

![grafik](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/a74c9086-2f02-4eaf-97e0-34f0a6adda4c)


For further analysis we would need an example report without external data sources and libraries
but with the same logic and with the according error situation. Then we can try tu debug your report and verify your situation.

title: NA
body:
I can't provide a report, but I found the issue. Actually it was just dependency conflict with the news libraries.
The "duplicate aggregation" was caused by Birt Aggreggation lib.
The Javascript one was caused by Mozzila.javascript v1.7.10 lib.

There are a lot of jars and it's difficult to say which one was updated because of name changes. Do you know a way to remove old version jars/unused jars? We are not using Maven.

(We migrated from birt 4.4 to 4.10 to 4.15, there are a lot of lib changes).

title: NA
body:
Probably the issue is caused because ATM BIRT uses locale-dependent conversions in many places, but obviously not always in the right places. I mean, in some places, it should be local-dependent, but isn't, or in other places, it is local local-dependent, but shouldn't be. Implicit type conversions can add additional issues (mostly in JS, though).

From my POV, errors like this could be avoided if *everywhere* we convert between strings and numbers, e.g. for showing and editing sizes, we would use the locale-independent basic Java functions that are meant for this, e.g. `Float.valueOf(s)` and `toString(f)`. I think such an approach is generally easier.
Then it would be clear that a dot always means the decimal point  and there cannot be a thousands separator; thus "123.456" always means one hundred and twenty-three plus a fraction, not 123 thousand.
BIRT is meant for people with a technical background, and the users will understand this.
And if locale dependent conversion is used, are we sure that we use the correct locale everywhere?

title: NA
body:
BTW many standards (eg. EN ISO 80000) say that (preferably narrower) spaces should be used as a thousands separator, to avoid such confusion. However, at least in Germany, for _monetary amounts_, a decimal comma is commonly used; in Switzerland an apostrophe (which also avoids confusion).

This comment and my previous comment are meant for readers from other countries (e.g. USA) which might not be aware of these intricacies. Of course Wim, Ed and Thomas know about this.

title: NA
body:
This is what I mean with "confusion".
The root cause of this may be the fact that the value contains a string which should be parsed as a number and a unit.
IMHO, such a string should _always_ use a decimal point and no thousands separator, because basically it is a CSS value and there is no "locale" concept for such values.
Thus the correct value should be `572.25pt`. Can you find out where the value is set and why it uses a comma?

title: NA
body:
Excuse my English, thank you very much for your quick interest.

It's "eclipse" debug mode, but I just need to know : 

How can i set to null  the second parameter here : ? when the first parameter is a date parameter type in birt report .

void org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.IEngineTask.setParameterValue(String arg0, Object arg1)


Thank you in advance ! Thomas

title: NA
body:
I have tried to understand your request but it isn't so easy
because it seems that you are not talking directly about the report himself.

I understand that you try to set the parametervalue via integrated java-call.
At this situation if I understand correctly you will have 2 parameters and you will set the 2nd to "null" if the 1st is a "Date"-parameter.

So you have to implements to steps:

1. step: evaluate the 1st parameter of your report
- option 1: if you know the report where you need this logic you can implements it based on the report name
- option 2: verification of parameters with "IParameterAdapter.getParameterDefinitionTask()" - but I have never used this before

2. step: set the value to your report-parameter
`<your interface implementation>.setParameterValue("parameterName", null);
`

My be this will help you a little bit for your next steps.

title: Excel, image scaling is wrong when only one image dimension is set
body:
The spudsoft excel emitter shows images into the created excel files with a wrong scaling when only 1 dimension is set.
The reason of this behavior is the internal default handling which calculate the missing dimension based on the original physical values
and not based on the scaling in combination of the given value and the physical dimensions (like on the designer or web viewer).

I will provide a fix for that topic.

### Image with given width and without height

![image-excel-no-height](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/2c7979c2-e187-43f8-a8d1-42bb89dd3745)

### Image with given height and without width

![image-excel-no-width](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/e3a93ed7-007d-4700-811f-c509c8707f7e)

title: NA
body:
The PR for this fix is #1751 

Here are the same screens from the issue with the fixed version:

### Image with given width and without height

![fixed-image-excel-no-height](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/06b06348-0953-429e-b404-02ef3efb2ac6)

### Image with given height and without width

![fixed-image-excel-no-width](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/956aefc0-8a5a-4d02-82fb-838db5f535aa)

title: Excel, small images will be scalled to large images and lose the original size
body:
The excel emitter (spudsoft) has an internal scaling to handle images in a special way for the excel output.
The excel which are too large and would overspan a cell will be shrinked, which is ok.
But images which have a smaller size like the cell will be grown.

The normal handling should be to keep the original image size of images which are smaller like the content cell.

### Screen with 3 cases:
- Case 1: standard image size without scalling - Ok
- Case 2: large image which will be shrinked to th cell - Ok
- Case 3: small image will be grown - Error

I will provide a PR for that. As fallback I will provide a user-property to restore the original behavior.

![scaling-standard-spudsoft-excel](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/b1d911fe-f871-4bf9-b6cf-bfde82c8c165)

title: NA
body:
The change is included at PR #1753 

The new user property is **ExcelEmitter.ImageScalingToCellDimension** (default: false). If it is set to true all images will be scaled to the cell dimension also the small images.

### Screen of new handling
![enhanced-scaling-standard-spudsoft-excel](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/142aaf63-c334-48d8-94a8-7b50f900c7e6)

title: NA
body: The change is merged to the master.

title: Birt Report Header Issue
body:
![Screenshot 2024-06-28 111711](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/81142929/3e78ed87-2b05-48fd-b91f-165f97923b0e)

Issue : 

- Unwanted Line and Image Repetition in Birt Report Header  

Details :

- Header contains image in background.
- The issue occurs when the text in the header's location field is too long.
- The background image in the header is repeated instead of the text being adjusted or wrapped appropriately.

Community Assistance Needed:

- Suggestions on how to adjust text and image properties in report headers to prevent repetition and misalignment.

title: NA
body:
You mentioned an unwanted line. Where is it?
Regarding the image repetition: What are the CSS properties for the background image (you can see them in  the advanced properties)? Note that there is a CSS property that can cause image repetition.
What do you mean with "text being adjusted or wrapped properly"?
There is no magic. If your text doesn't fit, it doesn't fit. To prevent this, you could eg. use a hilight rule (or an `onCreate` event) to reduce the font size if the text contains more than _N_ line feeds ("\n").

title: NA
body: Given there has been no response to the followup question, I'll assume this issue is not an issue that can be addressed.

title: Excel emitter configuration: enhance the designer "advanced property"-register to setup the configuration
body:
Currently the Excel-emitter (spudsoft) has lot of user-properties tp control the excel output.
The handling of the user properties is not simple because you have to know that the properties exists and it must be reserach in our BIRT-project source.

To support a bit mor of user friendly handling I will start to enhance the advanced register with the most common user-properties as configurable properties directly at design file level.

The internal handling will gve the user-properties a higher priority instead of the configuration.
This means is an user property configured then this value will be used and not the design file configuration to avoid issue with older versions.

The first change will only handle a few properties as starting point.
Afterwards with further PRs next options will be available.

And also the configuration of further emitter like "PDF" can be added here in future.

### Screen of the new configuration options

![display-excel-emitter-config](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/assets/41593722/45cd7d6f-6cad-4ae7-abf7-e4c41ec0d7fb)

title: NA
body: Nice idea!

title: securityDomain should be null if setSecurityController() was never called
body:
No report can be run when deploying birt 4.16 in a tomcat with securityManager on. I am trying to upgrade birt from an older 3 version and have tried with various combinations of java and birt 4 version yet I am having this error:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: securityDomain should be null if setSecurityController() was never called
   at org.mozilla.javascript.Context.compileImpl(Context.java:2422)
   at org.mozilla.javascript.Context.compileString(Context.java:1404)
   at org.mozilla.javascript.Context.compileString(Context.java:1392)
   at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.javascript.JavascriptEngine.compile(JavascriptEngine.java:214)
   at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.javascript.JavascriptEngine.compile(JavascriptEngine.java:1)
   at org.eclipse.birt.core.script.ScriptContext.compile(ScriptContext.java:127)
   at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ExecutionContext.compile(ExecutionContext.java:694)
   at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ExecutionContext.evaluate(ExecutionContext.java:686)
   at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ExecutionContext.evaluate(ExecutionContext.java:671)
   at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.EngineTask.validateAbstractScalarParameter(EngineTask.java:701)
   at
``` 

Seems related (or the same) as: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=412170. Yes I know the securityManager is deprecated and will be removed but I cannot drop it at this point. Anyone had a similar issue? 

Thanks.

title: NA
body: Just to respond to my own comment, patching birt as in: https://github.com/len-ro/rhino-fork-for-birt/tree/Rhino1_7_15_Release_branch solves this issue for birt 4.16 which is using js.jar 1.7.15. Maybe there is a more elegant solution to do this?

title: NA
body:
I have reserached the location of the security manager on the BIRT project.

But I cannot change something to handle an issue based from another project
when I have to use deprecated classes to make functionality available and later to remove it again.
We go ahead step by step to support higher JDK version so the next version will be LTS JDK 21
and so it is more important to remove the deprecated stuff.

May be your fix solved your problem. I started a draft-PR to remove the security manager.
But this will not solve your problem.

title: NA
body: Thank you for the response. You are right, the issue is in the rhino library which expects an additional config if a securityManager is set at jvm level (maybe in the way rhino is called from birt?). My rhino fork fixes the issue so I did not investigated further.

title: NA
body:
It seems to be that you use a rank()-calculation function of BIRT because the exception comes from "calculateRank()"
which tries to sort your list,
But your list hasn't any value and this case is not fetched. I changed this situation and it will be included with BIRT 4.17.
But you can take a look into your report to find the rank-function and in the meantime you can replace it with a standard SQL-rank-method.

No idea.
But if it worked correctly with BIRT 4.8 and with 4.14 it doesn't work correctly, with otherwise identical environments (web browser, OS, etc), then it is obviously related to changes between these versions.
Of course there are *lots* of changes in the source code, but maybe the reason isn't even in source.
I suspect:
Either there are changes in the sources regarding URL parsing (and/or writing)
Or a library that BIRT uses for this has changed behavior.

title: ClassCastException: Report-processing with "HTML-table-structures" cause exception if the structure contains comments
body:
If a report use dynamic data-content with html-table-structures then a class cast exception can occur if the structure contains html-comments. In my reports I used entered user text (=html-text) which can contains according html-structures: The following snippet will cause the exception: ```
standard text
``` ![html-table-processing](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b95f757b-7bf2-47f7-ac10-c8e5279aeb33) The reason of it is that the table-processor doesn't check the XML-node-type correctly. I will provide a fix for that.

title: PDF/A-3 support, validation fails
body:
I am trying to generate a **PDF/A-3** PDF with BIRT (as the first step of generating a ZUGFeRD invoice).
Unfortunately the VeraPDF validator complains about the generated PDF.

Validation error message:

Specification: ISO 19005-3:2012, Clause: 6.2.11.4.2, Test number: 2
If the FontDescriptor dictionary of an embedded CID font contains a CIDSet stream, then it shall identify all CIDs which are  present in the font program, regardless of whether a CID in the font is  referenced or used by the PDF or not

What I tested:

I used the example PDF `pdf_enhancement_version_PDF_A1A_FBfont.pdf` from [the PDF/A enhancement.](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/issues/1486)
I get the same result with a newly created trivial HelloWorld report with a TrueType font.

I used the latest VeraPDF Greenfield _development installer_ **1.27.33** (one can download it from https://docs.verapdf.org/install/).

I manually set PDF flavour PDF/A-3A or PDF/A-3B in the VeraPDF GUI.

I know that BIRT with the PDF/A enhancement does not directly support PDF/A-3, only PDF/A-1.
But I think it is worth adding support for it.
As such, the VeraPDF validation report also shows other errors which are expected.

Please note that earlier versions of VeraPDF may contain a bug which is directly related to this topic, see https://github.com/veraPDF/veraPDF-library/issues/1462. That issue was reported by Tilman Hausherr, the main committer of Apache PDFBox.

Please note that for PDF/A-3, the requirement for fonts is different in comparison to PDF/A-1.
If I understand this correctly, then PDF/A-3 requires that the "CIDSet" is either complete or not there at all, whereas for PDF/A-1 an incomplete set is OK.

There recently was a change in OpenPDF (see https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/1041).

I am not quite sure what is to do here.

First question: 
Obviously, we create an imcomplete CIDSet. And AFAIK BIRT uses OpenPDF 1.3.30. However, in the description of the mentioned issue, it is stated that this worked up to 1.3.30.

Much more important: How can we avoid the error?
I reckon that we would need to use a newer release of OpenPDF which includes the changes to allow disabling CIDSet generation, and this flag should be made acessible to BIRT developers as a UserProperty just like the other UserProperties from #1486.

title: NA
body: I didn't find a clear explanation about the differences between the 1.3.x, 1.4.x and 2.0.x releases of OpenPDF, except that the require Java 8, Java 11 and Java 17. Since BIRT itself now requires Java 17, we should use 2.0.x. @speckyspooky Probably, if you are going to add support for PDF/A-3 in the PDF emitter, then for PDF/A-3 (opposed to PDF/A-1), you need to call the new API `font.setIncludeCidSet(false);` for each font. The documentation says /** * Indicates if a CIDSet stream should be included in the document for {@link TrueTypeFontUnicode}. * When set to true, a CIDSet stream will be included in the document. * When set to false, and {@link PdfWriter#getPDFXConformance()} does not require it, * no CIDSet stream will be included. * * @param includeCidSet new value of {@link BaseFont#includeCidSet} */ Not sure about PDF/A-2, but I think it should work like PDF/A-3.

Currently the master builds are failing like this:
```
[ERROR] org.eclipse.birt.sdk.RuntimeTest.testChart -- Time elapsed: 0.161 s <<< ERROR!
java.lang.SecurityException: Invalid signature file digest for Manifest main attributes
	at java.base/sun.security.util.SignatureFileVerifier.processImpl(SignatureFileVerifier.java:347)
	at java.base/sun.security.util.SignatureFileVerifier.process(SignatureFileVerifier.java:289)
	at java.base/java.util.jar.JarVerifier.processEntry(JarVerifier.java:283)

	at java.base/java.util.jar.JarFile.ensureInitialization(JarFile.java:1037)
	at java.base/java.util.jar.JavaUtilJarAccessImpl.ensureInitialization(JavaUtilJarAccessImpl.java:72)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.URLClassPath$JarLoader$2.getManifest(URLClassPath.java:883)
	at java.base/java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:491)
	at java.base/java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:427)
	at java.base/java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:421)
```
I suspect it's the result of the changes to the signing service:

https://gitlab.eclipse.org/eclipsefdn/helpdesk/-/issues/4680#note_2548374

title: NA
body:
The signature files look different (have different names) with the latest signing service:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/68fb39f2-a241-48ff-a901-7c3446996889)

title: NA
body:
I noticed this is the log:
```
[INFO]  [buildJar] load bundle uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel from uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel_4.17.0.v202407221948
Jul 23, 2024 7:42:35 AM org.eclipse.birt.build.pack.FrameworkPacker log
WARNING: duplicate org.eclipse.birt.chart.device.pdf/META-INF/CODESIGN.SF
Jul 23, 2024 7:42:35 AM org.eclipse.birt.build.pack.FrameworkPacker log
WARNING: duplicate org.eclipse.birt.chart.device.pdf/META-INF/CODESIGN.RSA
```
So indeed the new CODESIGN.* files are ending up in the runtime jar and are of course invalid.   It's coincidentally convenient that yesterday I was cleaning up the org.eclipse.birt.build project which implements the ant tasks that builds the jar, so I know where to look to fix this...

title: NA
body:
That being said, older successful showed this:
```
[INFO]  [buildJar] load bundle uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel from uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel_4.17.0.v202407201614
Jul 22, 2024 1:11:33 PM org.eclipse.birt.build.pack.FrameworkPacker log
WARNING: duplicate org.eclipse.birt.chart.device.pdf/META-INF/ECLIPSE_.SF
Jul 22, 2024 1:11:33 PM org.eclipse.birt.build.pack.FrameworkPacker log
WARNING: duplicate org.eclipse.birt.chart.device.pdf/META-INF/ECLIPSE_.RSA
```
Probably original the name was ECLIPSEF and was intended to be filtered out:

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/blob/5f379b5b7dc7fffaff546b944adfe3ca1067aa08/build/org.eclipse.birt.build/src/org/eclipse/birt/build/ant/PackTask.java#L183C7-L186

I will try to enhance the filter.

title: NA
body:
I noticed this now as well:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b899b3b9-02e7-4b15-86b7-c4a64dc0c955)

So the last time this was a problem, more than 9 years ago, it wasn't fixed by fixing the ant task implementation but by post-processing the jar produced by that task.  Such a tangled web was woven...

title: NA
body:
The above ant hack will also be cleaned up.

Thank goodness the tests for the runtimes were enabled, otherwise someone downstream would have noticed this at some later point in time, do doubt when it's least convenient rather than the day after the signing service was updated.

title: NA
body:
The signature file names might be changed back to ECLIPSE_ but I already changed the pattern to accommodate that name as well:
```
"(.*\\.jar/)?META-INF/(ECLIPSEF|ECLIPSE_|CODESIGN)\\..*"
```

title: Support  for DuckDB JDBC
body:
[DuckDB](http://duckdb.org/) is an in-memory column-based high-performance OLAP database.
As such it could greatly improve the "BI" in BIRT.
Furthermore, it makes accessing a great variety of data sources a snap and it has excellent SQL support.

So I thought it would be great to create a sample report demonstrating how to use DuckDB to perform advanced SQL queries over Parquet or Arrow files (both are columnar storage formats).

DuckDB also can be used as a stand-alone CLI program (similar to e.g. Oracle SQL*Plus, but more advanced).

DuckDB includes a [JDBC driver](https://duckdb.org/docs/api/java).

I was able to install the driver (straightforward), create a report with a data source and test the data source successfully.

However, when I try to create a JDBC Select data set, this fails with an exception

`Unrecognized configuration property ",metadataBidiFormatStr"`

Note: The error message above is not copy-pasted, it is what I remember from yesterday when I was at home.

What I did:
- Install BIRT 4.16 report designer all-in-one for windows.
- Create a new new report project
- Install the JDBC driver (downloaded from https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/duckdb/duckdb_jdbc/1.0.0/duckdb_jdbc-1.0.0.jar )
- Create a new report
- Create a data source, choose the DuckDB JDBC driver and the URL `jdbc:duckdb:`
- Test the data source
- Download a parquet file as described in https://duckdb.org/2021/06/25/querying-parquet.html
- Create a JDBC select dataset with the DuckDB datasource and a query like this 

```
  SELECT count(*)
   FROM 'taxi_2019_04.parquet'
   WHERE pickup_at BETWEEN '2019-04-15' AND '2019-04-20'

```
Here, I replaced the filename with the full path.

As soon as I press OK in the DS editor, BIRT fails with the exception as described.

I don't say this is an error in BIRT. Obviously the DuckDB JDBC driver does not implement some metadata calls which BIRT seems to expect. However, it would be great if we can make this work somehow.

body:

I will take a look with the debuger and may be we have luck to see details which can help to find a solution of it.

title: Enhancement, JDBC driver manager - configuration of the property validation
body:
For the enhancement of #1825 the JDBC driver manager got a change to validate the supported driver properties (PR #1831, BIRT 4.17).
Through this change the support of the DuckDB driver is possible.

The target of this change is to give BIRT a fallback configuration and a small individual configuration to handle which driver(s) should be validated an which driver(s) should be excluden from the validation.

The reason of it is that the change of the JDBC driver manager is a central change and change the standard behavior.
The second reason is that it could be that the JDBC driver information of the supported properties are not full defined
and with this additional change it can be handled.

The following options will be given as *global system environment parameters* of the JVM:
- birt.driver.property.validation.enabled
o true, property validation is enabled (default)
o false, property validation is disabled

- birt.driver.property.validation.excluded.drivers
o unset, all drivers will be checked
o is set, the listed drivers will be excluded from the validation
o value, driver class name, for multiple driver listing a list splitted by comma separated class names can be used

** examples of global JVM parameters:**
- -Dbirt.driver.property.validation.enabled
o the validation is disabled

- -Dbirt.driver.property.validation.excluded.drivers=com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver
o validation is enabled but without the driver of "SQLServerDriver"

- -Dbirt.driver.property.validation.excluded.drivers=org.duckdb.DuckDBDriver,com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver
o validation is enabled but without the both drivers of "DuckDb" & "SQLServerDriver"

title: PDF-emitter: UserProperties like standard configuration at designer level
body:
The PDF-emitter provides a large set of user properties to handle special handling options like the prepend or append of PDF document.
Further options are the setup of PDF version or the configuration of PDF/A.
The challenge is to know that this options exists.

Thefore the idea is to add these options like configuration options directly at the designer.

title: Performance issue occurs when dataset has a parameter mapped to int8 type on PostgreSql
body:
I figured out there is a significant performance difference between using dataset parameters and statically applying filter with SQL statement.

Here is the simplified scenario;

About db table;
Table has timeseries data with ts column (int8) and timestamp value saved with epoch format (including ms)
create table tsdata(ts int8,val varchar);

Dataset's query:
with statically typed criteria: select t.ts,t.val from tsdata t where t.ts>1722782152000 and t.ts<=1723559752000 --> results appear about 5 sec
with dataset decimal/float type parameter : select t.ts,t.val from tsdata t where t.ts>? and t.ts<=? --> results appears or hangs in >10min

Possible cause:
type mapping issue between birt,jdbc and postgresql

Work around:
After 2 days of work including query tunings, PostgreSQL memory tunings and JAVA_OPTS settings, I found the possible cause is related with implicit type mapping or conversations. And I fix it such a way below.

1-User cast PostgreSQL function;
select t.ts,t.val from tsdata t where t.ts>cast(? as int8) and t.ts<=cast(? as int8)
2- And I adjust dataset parameter with string type

results appears in ~5 sec :)

Env.Info:
Birt All In One Designer (tried both v4.13 and v4.16)
Postgresql 14
Ubuntu 20.04 Desktop

Best Regards

title: NA
body:
I understand the mentioned topic with the time differences and the SQL executions.
But by default of course it is not a typical BIRT issue or a BIRT enhancement because the handling will be done based on the JDC-prepared statement and your used  JDBC driver.

The only thing what you can do for example to qualify your parameter at the dataset as "Integer"
(in the most cases it will be set to String insetad of the mentioned data type).
Then the parameter will be set as prepared-parameter with datatype "Integer" to the prepared-statement.

But here starts the Java-JDBC-level. I don't know if the JDBC driver will handle "Integer" according to your used type "int8".

title: NA
body:
To get rid of this issue, i think maping between jdbc types and postgresql types is crutiual. As you mention this is drivers behaviour. But there should be a way to set jdbc parameter type as bigint or long (8 byte). So driver may map the right type to execution.

I haven't use integer dataset parameter type because i thought 4 byte. Birt gives error if i select integer.
![Ekran görüntüsü 2024-08-14 110343](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f33fd71-1a72-4f90-ac8f-d97cb8d119ec)

If there is a way to add BIGINT option to dataset parameter and send this parameter's value to jdbc as long java type the problem might be fixed. Here i some findings about type mappings.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4ff718c5-9856-448c-ba15-d792b79c7c81)
Ref: https://www.instaclustr.com/blog/postgresql-data-types-mappings-to-sql-jdbc-and-java-data-types/

Best regards

title: NA
body:
Ok, in your case the integer is a long-integer.
Have you tried to use decimal / float to get the value exchanged?

The changed to support "long" / "bigint" would be no small change because it has eimpact on parameter side and dataset side.
Therefore if "decimal" or "float" would be work to then we would have currently a solution of it.

title: NA
body: It works with DECIMAL or FLOAT dataset parameter type, **but** it causes significant performance issue which is hard to understand and fix. Thats why i created the issue.

title: NA
body:
Using FLOAT is definitely not a good idea here.

> But there should be a way to set jdbc parameter type as bigint or long (8 byte). So driver may map the right type to execution.

From a user's perspective, you are certainly right, but as Thomas wrote:

> The changed to support "long" / "bigint" would be no small change

So don't expect this enhancement to actually happen unless you can provide a PR to implement this (including tests).

What I do to perform type conversion in BIRT queries is to use this pattern:

```
-- This is Oracle syntax, but you can easily adapt this for other SQL dialects
with params as
(
  select :p1 as foo,
         cast(:p2 as whatever_type) as bar,
         to_date(:p3, 'DD.MM.YYYY') as some_date
  from dual
)
select ...
from params
join x on (x.foo = params.foo)
...
``` 

I mean, I use each bind variable exactly once, and when I need to convert the type, I also have to perform the conversion only once.

I'm not an expert on PostgreSQL, but I guess what happens is:

The DB sees a conversion between an `int8` column and a `numeric` bind variable.
Now, implicit type coercion says that the `numeric` type is "broader" than `int8` and thus the `int8` side has to be converted to `numeric`. Unfortunately, this is the side with millions of values. These have to be converted for all rows, and (that's a wild guess:) maybe not even an index on that column can be used for the query due to the (conversion) function call.

So, since an enhancement to BIRT seems unlikely, your solution with the explicit cast or the very similar approach I mentioned, is probably the best way to go.

As an alternative, you could also modify the SQL itself in the `beforeOpen` event to write the values literally into the statement. But you have to be careful then, because that might open the door for SQL injection attacks. OTOH this way the query optimizer can see whether you only need the data for yesterday, or for the last 10 years, which makes a huge difference for the optimal execution plan, if there is an index for the column (full table scan or access by index).

title: NA
body:
Yes, I confirm the "**best practice**" of @hvbtup.
I use exactly the same for my PL/SQL-statements and fro T/SQL I use a modified version of it but with the same way.

```
-- T-SQL:
DECLARE @param01 BIGINT = TRY_CAST(? AS BIGINT);
DECLARE @param02 DECIMAL(10,2) = TRY_CAST(? AS DECIMAL(10, 2));

SELECT ...
FROM myTable
WHERE
  ID = @param01
  AND amount = @param02
;

```

title: NA
body:
> So don't expect this enhancement to actually happen unless you can provide a PR to implement this (including tests).

I wish i could send PR but i have no development experience on Birt project.

> 
> What I do to perform type conversion in BIRT queries is to use this pattern:
> 
> ```
> -- This is Oracle syntax, but you can easily adapt this for other SQL dialects
> with params as
> (
>   select :p1 as foo,
>          cast(:p2 as whatever_type) as bar,
>          to_date(:p3, 'DD.MM.YYYY') as some_date
>   from dual
> )
> select ...
> from params
> join x on (x.foo = params.foo)
> ...

Using parameters as join source is a new approach for me, thank you.

title: NA
NA
body:
The syntax `:p1` is just an Oracle specific syntax for named bind variables. This is equivalent to `?` in JDBC.

In fact, at least for BIRT, this is limited in comparison to other clients / programming languages. In other clients/languages, one can use `:p1` several times in the statement, while still supplying a value for it only once. This does not work in BIRT. Basically, in BIRT, one can assume that each `:variable` (except in comments) is literally replaced with a `?`.
Working around this limitation is another good reason for the `with params (...)` idiom. 

BTW the `from dual` clause is not needed in some other DBs (`dual` is a table with exactly one row)

title: NA
body:
Each new contributer is welcome to the BIRT project.

@mgulden 
If you start a change for that please think that the new data type "Long" should be available not only on parameter side and on JDBC-parameter-side.
Because there are many other objects which use the available/supported data types like integer, decimal and so on.

So different topics should be adjusted of it like:
- scalar parameters
- cascading parameter
- JDBC-parameters
- dataset result column data types
- data-element data tyes (based elements of tables)
- data cubes
- chart data types
- etc.

The current problem can be solved through explicit parameter-cast on SQL-side so I will close this ticket.

title: Excel & Indent (#1666): NPE can be produced in special cases of images without wrapped grid/table e.g. a single chart
body:
With BIRT 4.16 a new option of the excel-indent calculation was added.
The problem is that a NPE can occur if an image included on a report without a grid or table.
So the information of the cell alignment is missing because there is no cell element as wrapper given - the NPE will occur.

I will provide a fix for the NPE.

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f2b6abe-8085-4ef9-9500-a74b5175c6e5)

title: NA
body: Fix is merged to the master with PR #1856

title: BIRT 4.17, designer & Spudsoft excel: Spudsoft XLS & XLSX not longer created from designer-preview & designer-viewer
body:
Based on the latest changes I figured out a problem with the latest build series of BIRT 4.17, N202408061901 & N202408111146.
The problem is that the designer doesn't call the spudsoft emitter correctly to create the excel (XLS & XLSX) output.

I had a very, very small report only with a grid and an image/label but I got only the hint on brower level that the browser tries to connect the internal web server but it seems to be that the service couldn't be started.
The final result is that I didn't get any excel output. There is no log output or something else with a hint of the topic/problem.

**But** the confusing moment is that BIRT-4.17-OSGi-N202408111146 works fine and my local dev-version works fine too.
(I updated my local dev-installation will the latest updates and cleaned up the project to exclude external dependencies.)

@wimjongman & @merks:
Could you please to a cross check from your side. May be it is only o local topic on my side.

I tested the following situations:

1. all-in-one-designer
1.1 all-in-one-designer, create the excel directly: **excel = error**
1.2 all-in-one-designer, start preview and afterwards create the excel: **preview = ok, excel = error**

2. OSGi runtime, 
- create the demo at viewer level and afterwards create the excel: **preview = ok, excel = ok**

3. Local environment
3.1 all-in-one-designer, create the excel directly: excel = ok
3.2 all-in-one-designer, start preview and afterwards create the excel: **preview = ok, excel = ok**

### BIRT 4.17 all-in-one-designer, Screens of the lates build series:

title: NA
body:
Wow, it's really kind of a broken framework design.  If the org.apache.logging.log4j.util.Activator is started,  it lock `ProviderUtil.STARTUP_LOCK` and then later it unlocks it **if and only if** there is a provider.
 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7f2c6eed-a978-451f-98b1-e2088e4148e0)

Then, if a different thread comes to org.apache.logging.log4j.util.ProviderUtil.lazyInit() it will find that `ProviderUtil.STARTUP_LOCK` is locked and will block indefinitely:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b7843ea9-412d-47dd-b009-901704ca0fe7)

How broken is that?

---

I'm still concerned whether I'm seeing the same problem as @speckyspooky or a different problem.

The early activation appears to be a side-effect of the start levels of the product and although we might change those, if BIRT is installed in an Eclipse IDE, I would expect the same problem to arise.

But I don't know why it is working from eclipse-IDE. Could it be that the process handling is another one or there is later a logger given and will be used...

The key to the problem is the early start thread holding the lock.  I have no idea what's (if anything) has changed.  But it's a fundamental problem in the logging framework and I really want a fix that will allow BIRT to run in any IDE.

In any case, it's easy to reproduce now and I have prototyped horrible, sickening hack in uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.framework.ExcelEmitterPlugin.start hat does actually fix the problem at least when debugging:

title: BIRT, link styling "bookmarks" & "hyperlink": use configured styling and avoid standard hyperlink text decoration (#1025)
body:
BIRT support for label- and data-element the option to configure hyperlinks.
Hyperlinks can be web-links, bookmark-links or drill-through-report-links.

The current layout handling is to simulate the standard hyperlink text decoration like web-links.
So a label with auto-font-color "black" will be displayed with font-color "blue" and underline.
If another font-color like "auto" selected then this will be used but the underlined text remain.

The use case is on my side to implements "table of content" for statistic reports as summary for output PDF & DOCX.
In this cases I want to use myown configured layout style instead of the standard handling but currently it is not possible.

**The plan of this feature-request will be:**
1. Implementation of an option to **disable** the hyperlink text decoration as a standard layout option or keep it as it is.
2. Output types: HTML (preview), PDF, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, PPT shall be changed
3. The option can be set on script level
4. The link-click-event-handling won't be changed, only the styling will be optimized.

**Out of scope of the change:**
- The change will not implements the different text-decoration options which are available for web-pages.

I started a research and figured out that the handling of the hyperlink styling is different for all output formats.
Therefore the implementation will be done indivdually.

### Screen of the planned designer change - font style
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee4edc6b-7254-478a-ae3e-400a84a7276b)

### Example of the output "Preview" & "PDF"
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0be048bf-5103-40f5-92c6-7619cc0b422e)

I will provide a first draft PR for that feature-change.

title: NA
body: Maybe you could even add a style with a specific name (e.g. "hyperlink") that is applied to hyperlinks instead of the standard styling.

title: NA
body:
I will change the new HTML-CSS-class to a more generic value like "hyperlink-undecorated".
The internal naming will be "textDecoration" because this change could be enhanced in a later version to all available style options.
