body:
The missing entry will bei added Automatically,
so the reports will work like before.
The default is standard handling with hyperlink style.

title: Reports exported in DOC format does not show report content properly
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/discussions/1818
Originally posted by **PenghaiZhang** July 23, 2024 Hi everyone, I have report template created probably 10+ years ago. When my app integrated with BIRT 3.7.2, we could use this template to generate report in both different formats (e.g. HTML, PDF & DOC). Recently, we have upgrade BIRT to 4.16.0, and then we found that the report in DOC format does not show contents properly. Basically, words in a `text` tag are shrunken to super narrow and become invisible. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0fed117b-7340-4217-bb90-b3710b88c989) ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/de357b3a-18cc-40e1-809c-9b962c20aaa7) You can see from the above screenshot where the top line and bottom line are broken. Looking further to the table configuration, I saw the width is only 0.04cm. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7e414cc0-c013-4430-91dc-cbe57f6ae6d7) We found that if we change the content type from HTML to auto or plain, the width will become normal again. However, we do want to support some HTML tags in our reports. We also found that if we keep the content type as HTML but remove the text alignment, the content will be OK as well. Can someone give me some ideas about this issue ??

title: NA
body:
The discussion contains a radically simplified report (full source in XML is only a few lines) which shows that there is an issue with the DOCX emitter as well. The report is a 90cm wide master page, the content is only a 1x1 grid with a text item.
This is rendered as expected with the PDF emitter, but the DOCX emitter creates a file where the text is shown in an extremely narrow column, make it unreadable (nearly invisible).

title: NA
body:
The problem here is according of the MS Word definition that a colum have a width range between 0 and 55.87 cm.
Columns which are smaller or larger won't be displayed correctly.
(Familiar limitation is given with MS Excel and the column width.)

The problem of BIRT is that the maximum value should be set (if no width is that and the master page is larger like 55.87 cm)
to avoid hidden text/data.

The hard fact is that MS Word page is limited by 22in x 22in,
reference of MS Word page size:
[https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msoffice/forum/all/word-page-width/59026c0e-a701-4d25-aadd-813180deabda](url)

title: NA
body: I provided a PR #1869 to handle the maximum limit.

title: NA
body: The PR #1871 is merged to the master branch for BIRT 4.17.

title: Excel, antidiagonal: the antidiagonal is set at background of merged cells - visible if rows will be added (#1866)
body:
Based on the discussion #1866 and additional retests I figured out an issue with merged cells
and XLSX-creations if the run and render task executed separately (XLSX created from the preview for example).

In this case the antidiagonal line is given as hidden information at the last merged cell
and will be visible if the user add a row on Excel side.

### example screen of the hidden antidiagonal line

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5da3d83a-f448-4ede-9074-74400a641a4f)

I will provide a fix for this issue.

(Which is not the final fix of discussion #1866 - topic there is XLS and diagonal lines.)

title: NA
body: The fix is merged to the master branch with PR #1871

title: Excel, prototype emitter: avoid the diagonal print if the style is unset (= "none", discussion #1866)
body:
With BIRT 4.14 the new excel emitter option of diagonals & antidiagonals was added.
The implementation is done for Spudsoft XLS & XLSX. The enhancement is not supported for the old Excle-xls ermitter.

The problem is that different teams use this emitter and with the activation of the new options diagonals will be printed, see discussion #1866.

The topic is that the style property of the diagonals won't be checked currently so the effect of unwanted diagonal print is given.

I will fix the situation that the excel-prototype will check the style configuration too.
But the emitter won't get the full support of diagonals because only the Spudsoft-emitter of excel will be supported in future.

title: NA
body: The fix is merged to the master branch with PR #1873

title: Word, page size: output not limited to maximum possible width & height of word (#1869)
body:
Word pages are limited at width & height to 22in.
If a master page is defined with higher size values the word document will be created but the page-configuration of MS Word
is not longer usable which means the page register cannot be opend. The document seems to be invalid for the enduser.

### Exampl 01, Width: > 22in
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aab3f875-189e-4f00-ad24-6b1114a22a75)

### Exampl 02, Height: > 22in
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f353e85e-61e7-4d8d-b3b2-398dae6468f7)

I will provide a fix of it that the maximum size of 22in will be set if the master page definition is to long.

title: SOAP response, delete hostname.
body:
In case of errors in soap responses, the internal server name appears in the detail/hostname section.
Adding for all AxisFault from the search fault.removeHostname (); solves the bulk of problems.
But something else is responsible for issuing SAXParseException. I see that the generation of such errors is possible in many files (~ 150), but I cannot find the piece of code responsible for the final formatting/issuance to the user in order to suppress the display of hostname there.
I ask for help with this issue.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55764696-f3f8-49bf-9ae1-4d7911acdddd)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7ead1e10-e8d2-45ed-bab6-fea15204971b)

title: NA
body:
Good afternoon.
Yes, as a person not related to java development, the most difficult thing was to understand that the generation of these specific errors is not in the source codes.
But this is solvable using the Intercepting filter pattern for org.eclipse.birt.report.filter.
Although perhaps there are easier solutions about which I have no idea.

title: DOCX: margin of element "Label" not implemented (but available for element "Text" and "Dynamic Text"
body:
The current DOCX-emitter support margin handling for the elements "Text" and "Dynamic Text"
but for the element "Label" it is missing. The reason of it is that this margin handling wasn't implemented.

The margin option should be available for the Label-element to.

### Current situation of label-margin at DOCX:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/182cfa62-df1c-4133-a454-9e91c5a05010)

### Target of the upcoming change for DOCX with new handling:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bd9ffd7-763c-4938-a999-dbf6f4edcb7e)

title: DOCX, the margin of dynamic text/data elements will be calculated doubled
body:
Currently the Word emitter of DOCX calculate the margin of dynamic text elements like "text, "dynamic text" and "data elements" doubled. All elements which will be handled like embedded HTML elements have this problem.

The reason of it is that the word emitter creates currently a layout grid to simulate the margin based on the element style.
At the same time the embedded HTML text create his own layout based on the same style of the HTML element
(internally called "foreign text").

The result is  doubled calculated margin.

### Example of the double calculation of the margin:
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8ddfde11-e6ce-434a-879b-b01e5038698e)

I will provide a PR for that issue.

title: NA
body:
The PR change the internal handling of the HTML-interpretation of the text elements.
The DOCX emitter wrap the foreign text into an HTML-data stream and embed this part as an MHT-archive on DOCX.
This part will be transformed from Word to standard Word-elements.
By default the MHT-style would include the same margin the which was rendered through the wrapper table.
The PR set the foreign-text margin (left & right) to "0px" and so the doubled spacing after & before will be avoid.

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d42c42f6-ee8b-4b1a-941c-a5dd1e9b6c6a)

title: DOCX: MS Word with uncorrect style converting of font size "12pt" based on BIRT produced DOCX-documents
body:
Based on the discussion #1868 I started a research of the font-size styling topic to test different situations
what the font-size result will be given in compare of HTML -> (PDF ->) DOCX.

The styling from HTML to PDF is ok but a special situation with the font-size "12pt" cause a wrong style conversion in DOCX-documents.

The problem is that the HTML-content of the BIRT-elements "text", "dynamic text", "data" will not parsed into full supported DOCX-elements. Instead of a full parser the archive-/intermediate-format MHT(ML) will be used. These files embedded like external documents into the DOCX and will be converted through Word into the DOCX-elements.

**example of the internal DOCX-structure with MHT-files created by BIRT**
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8a7820fc-5330-46a4-94ce-a2f3d5f15690)


And there exists a kind of standard error on MS Word side because the font size "12pt" will be converted in every case into "10pt".
This topic is given at the HTML-tags "div" & "span" but also the HTML4.0-element font is not converted correctly for result size "12pt".
(BIRT produce the DOCX-Version: WordProcessingML, Version 2016)

I tried to replace the "div"-tag with the "p"-tag (paragraph). But the converting of Word is not the same for these both elements
so we would get side effects of styling. In special cases the styling of a p-tag will override the style of following elements.

Normally the best way would be to implements a DOCX-parser to avoid MHT-files but for that large efforts are needed to get it.
(Note: DOC-files from BIRT 4.6 was created correctly, for that file format a kind of HTML-parser is implemented but cannot used for DOCX.)

The smallest workaround is to use another font-size instead of "12pt" to get a better result.
So I will provide a PR that the font-size will be changed from "12pt" to "12.5pt".
I know this isn't the same font-size and therefore I call it workaround. But it is better like the currenty situation.

Note: The behavior of #1868 was not reproducable on my side.

### Example 01 of wrong converting
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6408d36d-7542-4998-97a4-dfd3749bc6e7)

### Example 02 of wrong converting
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8a75390a-2374-4065-a06a-54d10f6a646c)

title: NA
body:

The following screens provide the new result for the font-size for DOCX-documents.

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f8c4ee6d-292a-4f6f-9efc-90d003734c3f)

### Example 02
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6c6bdfed-b495-4614-ae65-9b12af9dbc71)


The PR with the solution is added with #1906

body:
Ok, yes I understand your problem. And it is very easy this answer. The element which is used for the page numbering is a standard PPT-text-element. The number is not the auo-page-counter-element.

So you won't get any changed page numbers. This is a change request because the element cannot changed by default.
There must be done at first the research of the PresentationML (of Office) and afterwards the page number handling for the emitter is to change.

So, I have started a small reserach and have new information for you.
At first this topic is not an BIRT issue this topic is based on the PowerPoint-behavior.

I figured out that the standard form at your report "1 of 30 pages" won't be supported by Microsoft-PowerPoint.
[https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/show-the-slide-number-and-total-number-of-slides-on-every-slide-e62b363a-a5c4-413e-b7b7-52c1a4d9dd02#:~:text=On%20the%20Insert%20tab%2C%20in,Text%20group%2C%20click%20Slide%20Number](url)

There is no dynamic handling of the total page, so in every case you have to change the total page number manually.

Solution for BIRT and page number. If you use the pageNumber-template then you will get an auto-page-count also at powerpoint side and the number will be changed if you remove slides.

MasterLayout:

[test_case_slide_page_number.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17173812/test_case_slide_page_number.zip)

So may be you can change your page-footer-design into this way.
The good thing would be the slides are counted corretcly and only the total page number must be changed.

title: BIRT Version >= 4.8 DOCX Export: NullPointerException Caused by Overflow Hidden Enhancement
body:
Hi Team,

I am exporting a DOCX file using BIRT version **4.8**. The DOCX generation utilizes the **AbstractWordXmlWriter.java** class. During this process, an issue arises due to the enhancement of the overflow hidden property on a table cell in DOCX (**see enhancement #369**). This leads to a **NullPointerException** because the method attempts to get the length of a text field, which may potentially be **NULL**.

When exporting a DOCX file using BIRT version **4.6**, it works fine because that enhancement is not present. In that version, it directly calls the **AbstractWordXmlWriter.java > writeString(txt, style)** method, which handles null values properly.

The enhancement code in **cropOverflowString()** was added before the **writeString(txt, style)** method (which is also called from **writeTextInRun()**). This enhancement methods does not include a **NULL** check for the text field.

**Explanation of How NULL Can Occur:** 
In the **AbstractWordXmlWriter.java** class, the **writeText()** method handles a txt field that can be NULL. If txt is NULL, it calls the **writeContent()** method in **DocWriter.java**, passing the **NULL** value as a parameter. This, in turn, calls the **writeTextInRun()** method in A**bstractWordXmlWriter.java**, which also takes the txt parameter.

Inside this method, if the overflow hidden property is set, it calls **cropOverflowString()**, passing txt as the text parameter. In the **cropOverflowString()** method, there is a line that initializes a **StringBuilder**:
**`StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(text.length() + 1);`**
Here, **text.length()** is called when txt is **NULL**, resulting in a **NullPointerException**.

**The latest version of BIRT also contains the same code.**

**Please find the stacktrace below:**
`Cause:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.writer.AbstractWordXmlWriter.cropOverflowString(AbstractWordXmlWriter.java:1204)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.writer.AbstractWordXmlWriter.writeTextInRun(AbstractWordXmlWriter.java:1166)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.writer.AbstractWordXmlWriter.writeTextInParagraph(AbstractWordXmlWriter.java:1077)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.writer.AbstractWordXmlWriter.writeText(AbstractWordXmlWriter.java:1094)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.writer.DocWriter.writeContent(DocWriter.java:272)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.AbstractEmitterImpl.writeText(AbstractEmitterImpl.java:1035)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.DocEmitterImpl.writeContent(DocEmitterImpl.java:258)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.AbstractEmitterImpl.startText(AbstractEmitterImpl.java:411)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.wpml.DocEmitter.startText(DocEmitter.java:397)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visitText(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:117)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.content.impl.TextContent.accept(TextContent.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visit(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visitChildren(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:171)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visitCell(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.content.impl.CellContent.accept(CellContent.java:215)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visit(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visitChildren(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:171)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.presentation.ContentEmitterVisitor.visitRow(ContentEmitterVisitor.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.content.impl.RowContent.accept(RowContent.java:69)`

title: Connection profile details saved in rptdesign file
body:
When using a connection profile the report designer keeps saving these details in the .rptdesign file.
I believe it sould not save them in the .rptdesign as long they are specified in the connection profile file.

report.rptdesign
```
<property name="odaDriverClass">org.postgresql.Driver</property>
<property name="odaURL">jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/my-postgres-database</property>
<property name="odaUser">user</property>
```

config.xml
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<DataTools.ServerProfiles version="1.0">
    <profile autoconnect="No" desc="" id="d04355a1-7c01-11ef-878c-9abc7ec407b6" name="claim2me_db_profile" providerID="org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc">
        <baseproperties>
            <property name="odaUser" value="user"/>
            <property name="metadataBidiFormatStr" value="ILYNN"/>
            <property name="odaDriverClass" value="org.postgresql.Driver"/>
            <property name="odaJndiName" value=""/>
            <property name="odaPassword" value="pass"/>
            <property name="disabledMetadataBidiFormatStr" value=""/>
            <property name="contentBidiFormatStr" value="ILYNN"/>
            <property name="odaURL" value="jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/my-postgres-database"/>
            <property name="disabledContentBidiFormatStr" value=""/>
        </baseproperties>
    </profile>
</DataTools.ServerProfiles>
```

title: NA
body: BTW this (unintented and superfluous saving of the property bindings) also happens if the data source is referenced from a library.

title: NA
body:
The idea of the connection profile is not to remove an existing connection from the BIRT-report if the connection-profile is used.
It is an additional option and the existing connection will not removed.
This avoid by standard problems if the connection profile is not available then the local connection of the report can be used.
You have to remove the connection manually or to enter dummy values.

In some of our production plattforms we have up to 5 system stages (development, test, prelife, producton, sandbox).
And ih you have such constellation then every stage have an own connection profile and the report connection supports only the development-stage.
Yes, we change in every case after the first draft is done the local report connection and use the connection profile.

title: NA
body:
Ok, i understand the workaround, and while using dummy values might seem like a functional solution, it's not ideal.

When you enable a connection profile, you lose the ability to modify the local connection of the report. If the intention behind the local connection is to serve as a fallback in case no connection profile is available, it should remain editable.

Now, consider this: if you're storing your report design in a GitHub repository (and it's well known that storing sensitive information there is unsafe), then the local connection details of the report could pose a security risk. This information could unintentionally fall into the wrong hands. Not even the local connection of the report for the development should end up there, you can just use a connection profile for all cases.

From a security perspective, connection details should never be saved directly within the report design.

One more thing. If you edit the connection profile directly in the xml file and reload the design, the details in the BIRT JDBC Data Source window will be the ones from the connection profile xml, thus hiding the actual local connection details of the report design. And it will save that data in the the report design file, overwriting the initial details that we presumed to be a fallback. This sure it's not intended behavior.

title: NA
body:

title: BIRT/HTML-output: hyperlink doesn't work for embedded svg-images because the pointer events will be forwarded
body:
BIRT has the standard option to add hyperlinks or drillthrough options to different elements.
This option is also available for images.

If SVG-images will be used then appears a topic with the eventhandling of the browsers.
The pointer-event from the hyperlink will be delegated through the embed-tag directly to the embedded SVG-document.
The result is that the click fpr the hyperlink doesn't work correctly.
This is only a special behavior of SVG which will be added as documents to the HTML-output.
All other (raster-)images embedded (raster-)images too works correctly.

### Screen of the embedded SVG, without click-hand
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/40cfe684-4725-4b7f-aca7-23b490908cc4)


### Screen of the embedded PNG, with click-hand
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f3a3340e-9c45-4dbb-a3e2-306cc170a989)

I will provide a change for it.

title: NA
body: The small enhancement is added to the master PR #1925. I tested the standard image-cases and chart-cases (chart output like SVG). This change has no side effects to chart-svg-eventhandling.

title: BIRT error reading files with beforeOpen on linux tomcat 9
body:
When reading database connection details with beforeOpen function on tomcat 9 on linux birt runtime seems to read the values incorrectly. On windows works fine.

Its surrounding the parameters that it reads with the following string: `"` leading to values like  `"mySecretPassword"`

I am reading database connection details with the beforeOpen function and because the connection is unsuccessful it throws multiple errors.
Also, it dumps the entire error in the http response revealing possible sensitive information...

This seem to be a vulnerability.


[error.dump.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17190339/error.dump.txt)
[env.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17190352/env.txt)
[beforeOpen.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17190380/beforeOpen.txt)

title: NA
body:
This is not a BIRT-issue by default because you have extracted all details externally.
So you created an external XML-file with the configuration details.
You have hand written the reading of the config-xml and the XML-parsing.
As last step you set the config-properies and try to start the connection which crash.

But the problem is in my point of view not BIRT by default. The question is which data will arrive the beforeOpen.
And will be set the correct values to the connection.
The message of `"MY_SECRET_USER"` is a default error message from birt this is right but means not that the value has really quotes on it.

Your error dump means that there is an error on the getConnection based on the JDBC-driver and the error means the cause of it could be the user name "MY_SECRET_USER", but it could be another value which causes trouble because it seems that you have multiple problems according to the message.

And here only like an example, I have done today some testing and my NPE got the same message with quotes to,
only as a string for compare the message has nothing to do with your case:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c21d20e-52f8-4b1e-a832-1f9dcb1ded43)

title: NA
NA
body:
You can do a simple test.
You can overwrite the SQL-statement in your beforeOpen to see the parsed XML-values as a result of a simulated SQL.
And may be you will see if there is a problem with the parsed XML-data.

Let us know if we cann support you and we can open a discussion of it.

title: DOCX: padding of element "Label" not implemented
body:
The current implementation of the DOCX emitter has no implementation of padding for the BIRT element "Label".
The padding of the label should be added according to margin to set the according indents.
( This enhancement is familiar with #1895)

The difference from "label" to dynamic text will be that no special grid will be used, only the indent will be used.
MS Word doesn't support a real padding.

Additional on it some methods of the existing margin-padding-calculation are doubled with multiple implementations.
I will provide a PR to add the padding-calculation and optimize the methods.

title: NA
body:
I'm not sure what you want to achieve.
If I understand correctly, the old version supported margin, but didn not support padding, and with your change, it supports padding, but not fully. It treats padding the same as margin, but the HTML box has distinct values for border, margin and padding for a reason. For example, to where background color extends.

Maybe it would be better to just document that the DOCX emitter doesn't support padding for labels (and plain text dynamic text items?).

title: NA
body:
The current elements of "dynamic text", "text", "data" supports the paddding values.
This is the reason why the special padding-grid will be created to simulate the padding mechanism.
The support of padding values is a good feature but there are different implementation ways.

My target is here to provide the padding based on the indent-mechanism for ms word of the "label"-element.
The main target in future would be to have an option to change the padding calculation in generally to avoid the usage of the padding-tables but to remain the indent-calculation based on the values of margin-& padding.

title: NA
body:
I understand and that it will be useful in common cases.

However, it will not fully support the box model (e.g. background color would not work as intentend, border will not work at all, I suppose) and it will change the behavior of existing reports.

I was going to write: "Also, please keep in mind that items may use `display: inline` instead of the default `display: block`". But AFAIK this feature doesn't work anyway with the DOCX emitter.

title: NA
body: The enhancement is added with PR #1942

title: Chart CSS styles classes do not affect charts
body:
I usually override the default [BIRT built in styles](https://forums.opentext.com/forums/developer/discussion/58256/birt-exturnal-css)  simply by defining them in the stylesheet that I include in the report. The table related styles work well but none of the styles for charts work. The following chart styles don't appear to work:

.chart Chart
.chart-title Chart Title
.chart-value Chart Value Label
.chart-axis Chart Axis Label

Example in my included style.css file I will have 

```css
	.chart-title {
	color: red;
	}
```
This has no effect on the chart. I am using latest BIRT 4.17.0 but I have tested with previous versions in the past and had same issue.

title: NA
body:

It would be good to have a version from your side to use the same CSS situation from your side.
So it seems that you use external CSS instead of the internal CSS-definition or you have imported your CSS-style...

Therefore an example would be great for testing.

title: NA
body:
I have attached two files. A report and a CSS file. The CSS file has the BIRT default styles and you will see that the CSS classes for the data table work. The CSS classes for the chart do not have an effect on the chart. As an example .chart-title should make the title in the chart blue but it does not. Same applies to the other chart related CSS classes. 

[chart_css.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17488450/chart_css.zip)

title: NA
body:
Ok, I tested your report and the topic is that only "chart" is currently supported with BIRT.
The topic in generally is that the charts will be created as SVG and so the style properties can be different from standard html-CSS-properties, e.g. text has no style-property "color" it is "fill".

But the main topic is your reference information are comming from opentext-dev-team and they have there own integrated BIT version which is not the standard BIRT version.

Therfore you can use the style properties only with the opentext-BIRT-version.
If you use the open source version then you can see at the CSS-preference-side which style-classes are supported.

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f5734869-859c-46c1-9ae5-1a16c362b141)

The alternative for our BIRT is to yous the chart-methods to change the coloring instead of CSS.
Here is a very small example of a color change of the chart-axis-title.

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad4d4ad3-51de-43a8-abf2-d8a78cb9c181)

title: Tab characters break PDF/A conformance
body:
When a data item contains text like (in Java/C/JS syntax) `"abc\tdef"` containing a horizontal tab character (U+0009), this breaks PDF/A conformance.

I examined this in more detail.

In the resulting PDF, the tab character is contained as text in the content stream, using the "Times-Roman" font.
This font is one of the "builtin" PDF fonts, not a TrueType font. Thus it is not embedded (or subsetted) into the PDF.
This means, the glyph metrics and shapes are not contained in the PDF.

But PDF/A requires that all fonts must be embedded/subsetted.

What happens internally is:

There is a class `FontSplitter` in BIRT which is called from `ChunkGenerator.getNext()`, which in turn is called from `TextCompositor`.

It's task seems to be to ensure that every character of the text can be displayed; so it uses rules to select a font for each character (most font files only support a small subset of the Unicode characters).

In case of the TAB character, the method `FontHandler.selectFont(c)` returns "Times-Roman".
This happens when the preferred font (in my case, "Arial") does not support the character (method `charExists(c)` return null).
By the way, `charExists `for TrueType fonts looks for the glyph metrics, whereas `charExists` for Type1 fonts works very different.

The BIRT logic thinks that "Times-Roman" supports the TAB character, and thus, this font is selected.

Other control characters in the Unicode Code Point range 0-31 will proably cause issues, too.

In an ideal world, text in data items would not contain any TAB characters.

I am not sure how the different control characters *should* be handled by the different emitters.

Furthermore, I am not aware of an obvious workaround/solution without changing BIRT Source code.

I looked at some TrueType fonts (including some fonts for Code 39 and Code 128 barcodes, consola.ttf, arial.ttf, arialuni.ttf. None of them supports the TAB character.

The reason is obvious: A TAB character cannot have a glyph width, because its width is dynamic by definition.

title: NA
body:
[tab_character_pdfa.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17487918/tab_character_pdfa.zip)
This rptdesign file can be used for demonstrating the issue: When a PDF report is created with BIRT, it references the Times-Roman font.

title: NA
body: I'll create a PR which fixes this specific issue with the TAB character by replacing it with a space for PDF output...

title: PDF syntax error
body:
BIRT (as well as obviously a lot of other programs) creates PDF files that are not strictly valid PDF.

The VeraPDF validator shows this as a warning:

**Special graphics state operator (cm) inside Text object**

The [PDF 1.0 specification](says: https://opensource.adobe.com/dc-acrobat-sdk-docs/pdfstandards/pdfreference1.0.pdf) says on page 93:

> None of the graphics state operators described in this section can be used within a
> path object. All except those that save and restore the graphics state (q and Q) or set
> the CTM (cm) can be included within text objects.

In other words: The `q`, `Q` and `cm` operators must not be included within text objects.

This is what VeraPDF complains about, but (IIRC) this error is so common that until now, it is only considered a warning.

I created a solution for this in the (now deleted) tagged-pdf branch.
This is available at my fork https://github.com/triestram-partner/birt/tree/tagged-pdf, see 373925c6cae69b95a27b3698d4119465ce7f6619

title: Regression: Scripted Dataset events frequency changed
body:
One of my reports uses scripted data sets to get data from a Java "bean".

This report was developed with BIRT 4.2.1 and works with 4.2.1 and 4.3.0.

After updating to a BIRT version somewhere betwen 4.14 and 4.15 (to be more precise: https://github.com/triestram-partner/birt/tree/Reporting-2.2.3-20240206), the report changed behavior, resulting in wrong results because I add numbers in a scripted dataset `onFetch` event.

I added log statements to the beforeOpen, afterOpen, open and fetch events.

Old behavior:
open
fetch indx=0
fetch indx=1
open
open

New behavior:
open
fetch indx=0
open
fetch indx=0
fetch indx=1
open
fetch indx=0
fetch indx=1

You see that the `fetch` event is called more often than with the old version.

I'll try to create a minimal example demonstrating the issue.

I reckon that the caching of dataset results has changed somehow.

title: NA
body:
More info: There are three layout items which are referencing the dataset:
1) a grid
2) a table
3) a list

So, Calling open three times is correct.

Calling fetch only once for the grid item could be considered OK, as well as calling it once per row for the table and list items, but this is still a regression.

title: NA
body:
[scripted_ds_events.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17542593/scripted_ds_events.zip)

Example report

title: NA
body: I tried to debug the simple report, but I fail to understand what happens. The data engine is a maze of undocumented code.

title: NA
body:
The way the scripts are called now doesn't seem *wrong*, anyway (neither was the old behavior).

I tried searching the Git commit logs, but between the years 2013-2018, most of them are not really helpful.
So I don't know if this behavior change was intended or not. and we'll probably never find out.
I reckon that something about caching or not caching results has changed.

So this behavior seems unspecified and undocumented until now.

In my case it was quite easy to fix the report's behavior once I say the different event sequence.
I just needed to take note if I already processed a record (adding numbers to sums) or not, to avoid processing it twice.

title: Excel: streaming mode of xlsx can cause exception if not all columns makred as tracked for column width calculation
body:
The excel emitter can cause an exception if the streaming mode of xlsx is enabled and not all columns marked correctly for the column width calculation.
To solve this topic the auto column calculation will be enabled if the streaming mode is enabled.

I will provide a PR for it.

title: WordEmitter, DOCX: Improve current docx-output to simplify the created wpml-structure of docx
body:
The current word emitter has currently some challenges if the user tries to work with the result.
From user side the BIRT-docx isn't like a standrad word-document and it is not easy to change the word-documents based on the created huge count of grids and empty lines (paragraphs).

**The main topics are:**
- The emitter creates for each HTML-text-element a wrapped grid.
- Multiple specialized empty paragraphs will be used.
- Based on this systematic of used wmpl-grids the additional empty paragraphs are necessary to avoid exceptions if docx-document will be opend.
- The the header and the container area get a grid by default
- The list element get for (BIRT-)styling reason a grid (which is fine) but with additional empty paragraph

**Discussions were done before:**

#1352 DOCX with additional lines add header and footer

#1879 DOCX grid arround all HTML-wrapped text paragraphs

**Reserach result:**
- HTML-text grid-wrapped: The main reason is that the grid will be used for margin-padding implementation. And further investigations (debugging) shows that the main cause of the usage is the usage of the MHT-file for HTML-text and the wrong usage of supported HTML-style-attributes for MHT-HTML which can be converted/understand by Word.
When the correct attributes will be used the margin is given like on my implementation of the Label-element.

- Header-Footer-grind: Is not longer necessary because it has no specific effect (comfirmation of #1352). Different style tests had no negative effect if the container wasn't added. The positiv effect was the structure is easier and the empty paragraph won't be added.

- List-element need the additional grid to implements the border effect. So it won't be changed but the empty paragraph isn't necessary.

**Upcoming changes:**
1. Improve the MHT-file handling to activate the standard margin
2. Allow the combination of margin & padding handling (point 1) to simulate the current handling
3. Avoid the additional grid and paragraph on header & footer
4. Avoid the empty paragraph of the list grid cell
5. Add new standard option for WordEmitter-user properties
6. All options can be controlled by user properties to change back the behavior because the docx-structure will be changed

**Planned timeline:**
I will implements these changes and will create a PR for BIRT 4.18

title: BIRT 4.14.0 - Parameters (String/Date) without "Is Required" are not updated when the report is executed
body:
In BIRT 4.14.0, there's an issue where String and Date parameters that are not marked as "Is Required" are not updated properly when the report is run. This means that if a parameter is left blank or has a default value, and it's not set as "Required," BIRT doesn't update or apply the new value when the report is executed.

This problem didn’t occur in BIRT 4.8, where these parameters worked correctly.

title: NA
body:

And the best case would be a small test example where we can follow your problem. 
Have you tested newer versions to like BIRT 4.16/BIRT4.16?
Is a specific output format involved or a problem in generally?

I have done a smaller test with optional parameters and optional parameters with default values but I see no update problem on runtime of a report.

title: WordEmitter DOCX: Add the option of combined margin-padding calculation at the label element according to the (dynamic) text element
body:
The label element has the new option to use margin and padding for the DOCX output (PR #1942).
And with the change of the optimized DOCX output (PR #1942) the option to setup the calculation of margin & padding is given.
With usage of the user property "WordEmitter.CombineMarginPadding" can be defined if only margin or margin & padding is to use to get the calculated indent.

This option should be recognized for the label element too.

I will create a PR for this change.

title: Combo box and List box which allow multiple values - reportContext.getParameterDisplayText() return null
body:
Hello all,
for parameters with multiple values - combo or list box - you can use this code to get selected values:

```
reportContext.getParameterValue("parm1").join(",")
or simple
params["parm1"].value.join(",")
```

But this doesn't work for displayed text for options (labels)

```
reportContext.getParameterDisplayText("parm1").join(",")
```
**TypeError: Cannot call method "join" of null**

Function getParameterDisplayText() return value only for combo without "allow returning single value". Is it bug or is there some simple option to get Text for multiple checked values?

Regards

title: NA
body:
I started a small investigation and of course currently this option is unsupported.
It is not a bug, the source code contains a hint that the display text is unsupported of multi selection parameters.

title: NA
body: Currently I try to figure out the reason and will check if there is an improvement possible.

title: NA
body:
The situation till BIRT 4.17 is like discribed that the feature is unsupported.
With ticket #1981 an enhancement is planned and can be provied in best case with BIRT 4.18.

title: DOCX: Add the emitter configuration for the new layout option to the advanced register (#1957)
body:
With the change of the enhanced layout options of the WordEmitter for docx new user properties are added.
The user properties should be directly accessible at the "advanced property" register according to the existing PDF- & Excel-emitter configuration.

Additional on it the header-footer configuration must be checked because the layout switch not correctly.

I will provide a PR for both parts.

title: DesignElement: Handling to avoid access to encrypted password from script should not cause "RuntimeException"
body:
With change #575 the option to get the encrypted "oda password" from script side was stopped.
This is a kind of security mechanism. Here are involved all parameters which has a binding to a data set to get the data dynamically.

If there is a try to fetch the oda password an RuntimeExcption will be throuwn to avoid the fetch.
The problem is here that the scripthandling will be brooken see #1617 where is given a very good case description
and with usage of the methode "getSelectionList()" the excpetion can be produced.


This change has also an impact for other specialized external PlugIns for BIRT which use the parameter task to get information from the parameters. Such special PlugIns will be detected also as scripted processing.

The solution here is to avoid that the RuntimeException will be thrown.
Instead of that it would be enough to return "null" of it. With this way the password is unpublished to the script context and the script can run anyway.

I will provide a PR for it.

title: DOCX: new handling of word cause an word-error if the word-paragraph is empty
body:
With the modernization of the word structure #1957 for foreign text content (= html content) the layout grid will not longer used.
This cause a word error at opening.
The condition of it is that the foreign text is internally "null" and part of a grid cell or table cell.
The foreign content with content value "null" creates internally a word-paragraph but without content structure.
The internal structure of foreign content should be created for every content situations and for a null value an empty foreign-content shall be created.

This wasn't a problem with the old version because many empty paragraphs was created at the end of a cell.

I will create a PR for the fix.

title: JavaScript: JS editor will get additional highlighting of public objects
body:
The javascript editor will get additional highlighting information of public objects.

The following highlights will be added:

- _jsContext = object of JS context
- _statusHandle = object of the status handle
- report = report object
- config = configuration object
- currentPage = current page equal to pageNUmber

The optimized version of the word structure has a problem with the margin & padding calculation.
The problem is that the indent value is to high if "mm" was used.

After research I figured out that the convert-method calculate the measure wrongly.

I will create a fix for that.

title: List box, display text: enable the parameter task to handle the display text of multi selections for list box parameters
body:
The current handling of parameters and there display text doesn't support the option to get the selected display text results of a list box which is marked as multi selection.
The display text implementation allows only to get the value of a single selection list and for multi selections is the return value "null".
This handling is offical documented at source code side.

This enhancement is created to implements the option of display text for both versions of single selection and multi selection for list boxes.
There are different tickets where the feature was addressed and on of the latest is #1967.

I will create a PR for the enhancement.

```
params["paramMultiSelectionList"].displayText
params["paramMultiSelectionList"].displayText.toString()
params["paramMultiSelectionList"].displayText.join("~")
reportContext.getParameterDisplayText("paramMultiSelectionList").join("~");
```

title: Security-Issue sonatype-2018-0590 (possible XXE (eXternal XML Entity)-attack when Using XML as Data Source)
body: Hello, Our security-scan recently reported a security vulnerability in the rhino library, namely **sonatype-2018-0590** with the following explanation: This library is included in the Birt Engine (v4.14.0). I can confirm that the Birt Engine processes XMLs extended by XXE accordingly and that the vulnerability can therefore be exploited. An example for a manipulated XML with XXE-attack: The result of the exploited vulnerability in this case is that the contents of the /etc/passwd - file are printed in the pdf. Although the rhino library has been updated in Birt version 4.17, the vulnerability can still be exploited. I suspect that the processing of XMLs in the Birt Engine as a datasource is not implemented with rhino. Is this known and can the processing of XML with external XML entities be prevented?

title: NA
body:
Disclaimer: This is just my personal opinion.

BIRT uses Rhino. Rhino is a Javascript implementation written in Java, and you can use all Java libraries from within Javascript.
The BIRT reports can contain Javascript which is executed when the report runs.

So you could just as well read /etc/passwd with a little Javascript *without* using this XML weakness.

When you use BIRT, it ist essential that you don't run reports (or libraries called from reports) from untrusted sources, because a BIRT report can do everything that the process running BIRT can do.

That said, BIRT does not use Rhino to read the *.rptdesign / * .rptlibray files, and AFAIK BIRT does not use Rhino to process XML datasources. Instead, BIRT uses Java libraries for reading and writing XML.

title: NA
body:
I'm not sure the basis for asserting that the exploit you describe is in some way related to the version of rhino that's being used.  The issue that you show says 1.7.12 fixes the problem and given BIRT 4.17 uses 1.7.15  there is some kind of contradiction or confusion there.

As @hvbtup suggests, if the sources of your report inputs are not secure then you need to secure those inputs such that they do not contain content that can comprise your server or can produce compromised reports.

I expect there are places where BIRT processes XML where we could and probably should disable some of the vulnerable aspects in the existing XML libraries, e.g., entity resolution and external DTDs.  But who is going to do that work or fund that work?  I expect no one will do either.

title: NA
body:
Thanks for the replies so far.

I understood, that
- Birt does not use rhino for processing XMLs ( i obviously misunderstood what rhino does and what it is for)
- Despite securing the report inputs a patch in birt directly would be awesome, but I unterstand, that patching this issue is unlikely due to missing resources/capacities.

Securing the report inputs is what we already did. 

So I guess this issue will/can be moved to your backlog for maybe fixing in the future?

title: NA
body: As @merks said, based on the information you gave us, the issue is already fixed in 4.17.

title: NA
body:
The issue is fixed in rhino, yes. 
But the XML-processing, as @merks mentioned, is obviously not done with rhino at all. And that is what I can confirm, because when using XML as datasource in Birt reports, the security issue can still be exploited - even in Birt 4.17. So there is another issue in some java library, but as I understand one would have to analyze how XML is processed and fix it there (but this is unlikely to happen due to missing resources/capacities).

title: NA
body:
It seems to me that the XMLDataSource implementation uses Apache the Xerces library.
And https://www.contrastsecurity.com/security-influencers/xml-xxe-pitfalls-with-jaxb implies that this library uses unsafe defaults.
On https://github.com/nokia/OWASP-CheatSheetSeries/blob/master/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.md it looks similar.

There are a lot of places in BIRT where XML is processed, and as far as I understand it, one needs to explicitly configure the parser to work in a safe way befure using it.

So I think, to make XML processing secure everywhere in BIRT, there are quite a lot of places in the code where this configuration code must be added.
OTOH, most of these places is where XML files from the local file system are parsed, so, if we assume that these files are under our control, it's not really an issue.

The XML datasource is different here, because the XML data might come from eg. a WebService, which should be considered an untrusted source.
So I think it makes sense to add code for safe configuration to the place where the XML data from an XML data source is read.

Probably this is somewhere in https://github.com/eclipse-datatools/datatools/tree/master/plugins/enablement/org.eclipse.datatools.enablement.oda.xml/src/org/eclipse/datatools/enablement/oda/xml/util.

I created [an issue](https://github.com/eclipse-datatools/datatools/issues/22) in the datatools plugin repo for this.

Once this is fixed in the datatools plugin, BIRT should use the fixed version of this plugin.

title: NA
body: I don't think the are other places directly in BIRT but in upstream dependencies there likely are other similar problems.  But they will need to be addressed upstream; investment in free goodness is required.

title: NA
body: Thank you...will the fix be available in Birt 4.18 then?

title: NA
body:
Yes, this particular change will be available, in the release and is already available here:

https://download.eclipse.org/birt/updates/nightly/latest/

Note that I don't assure that this change addresses the actual problem you describe which is more likely to come from the datatools project:

https://github.com/eclipse-datatools/datatools/issues/22

title: NA
body: I will try to check the nightly build, if I can reproduce the problem or if it is fixed and give feedback here.

title: NA
body: Ed's fix seems to work (see my comment in https://github.com/eclipse-datatools/datatools/issues/22). The error handling could be improved, but that can be done later.

body: As suggested I downloaded the nightly build (which was from yesterday --> birt-runtime-osgi-4.18.0-202411271252) and I still can reproduce the problem. Was the fix included in that build?

title: PPTX: internal hyperlink to bookmarks of images currently unsupported - image will be supported
body:
The current implementation supports the usage of internal hyperlink to bookmarks for text labels.
So it is possible to jump to an internal document target.

The configuration of internal hyperlink can be done for images but the internal hyperlink doesn't work.
The reason of it is that this option is currently unsupported and the logic is not implemented.

I will provide a change of it..

title: How to apply dataset filter expression while get parameter selection list?
body:
Hello,  

i have a report design with a dataset and a filter expression like the following one:
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/82405fda-21d5-4f09-9f01-b44f599ee055)

This data set will be used as dynamic values source for a report parameter.  

My problem is now, that the filter expression will not apply, while fetching the values of the parameter with help of the java method: IGetParameterDefinitionTask#getSelectionList

This behavior was changed with version 4.8 and is already mentioned in https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/commit/e19c5f5c4f839ada0a5a0f2e16d22bfd00adc821#r39507859

Now my question: Is there any way to change the DataEngineFlowMode for this use case? Or is there another way to fetch the parameters, considering the filter expressions of a data set?

title: NA

But be aware it could be that you get in trouble with the topics of the discussion which cause the change.

title: 4.19 Releng
body:
Tracks the release engineering activities for the 4.18 release.

### Opening actions
- [x] Update version numbers
- [ ] Create Milestone 4.20 in Github
- [ ] Move 4.18 open issues to 4.19
- [ ] Create Release in [Project Administration](https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/technology.birt)

### Release day - 7
- [ ] Announce new release pending in discussions
- [ ] Revisit all open tasks

### Release candidate (Milestone) - testing
- [ ] BIRT 4.18 All-In-One designer
- [ ] BIRT 4.18 runtime
- [ ] BIRT 4.18 runtime OSGi

### Release day
- [ ] Create Github release (Creates Tag and Announcement in Discussions)
- [ ] Update [README.MD](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/blob/master/README.md)
- [ ] Update 4.19 Release in [Project Administration](https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/technology.birt)
- [ ] Create 4.20 Release in [Project Administration](https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/technology.birt)

With a tiny bit of participation folks could prevent problems that affect them being in a release.  The nightly build with a fix is available to anyone. These strings should contain "Document" instead of "Docuemnt".

I'm +1 for fixing these even though this might break a few existing reports.

title: Issue with inline "Total Page" autotext format in PDF
body:
I noticed an issue with "Total Page" autotext formatting in the following scenario:

- Run and Render mode
- PDF Output
- The component has "inline" display mode

If all these conditions are met, we notice that the component width is oversized as show in the example below:
[report.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18360173/report.pdf)

We can reproduce the issue using this simple rptdesign:
[report.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18360220/report.zip)

I did a first research to try to identify where the issue could come from. I found a pointer in [AreaFactory](https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/blob/bd4d5ea68c9780af5fd56a25ee564ce030ba3694/engine/org.eclipse.birt.report.engine/src/org/eclipse/birt/report/engine/nLayout/area/impl/AreaFactory.java#L75) as we can see that there is a special handling of total-page autotext in PDF and Run and Render mode. I suppose that the TemplateAreaLayout returned in this case results in a different layout than the InlineTextArea that would be returned for a "page number" autotext.

title: NA
body:
Can you give us some information about the BIRT version which you have used.

And what should be the expacted result?
So yes, I saw your pdf-document and it would be helpful to have the compare or "given" and "expacted" result
because for me it is unclear what the issue is. Ok, it is an inline text but the consequences are unclear for your issue here (for me).

title: NA
body:
The total page count is not yet known when the PDF pages are created.
Only after all pages are written does BIRT know the total page count (AFAIK).
That's why a PDF XObject must be used for the total page count. You can forward-reference a PDF XObject in a page and add the details for the XObject later. This way, BIRT can create the PDF in one pass.
Some other tools need two or even more passes for creating the output if there is any forward reference. An example for this is TeX.

Since BIRT does not know how many digits are needed for the page count (up to 9 pages, one digit would suffice, up to 99 pages, 2 digits would suffice etc). BIRT is quite pessimistic and reserves room for  5 or 6 digits (I don't know the details).

If you want to show the total page number left-aligned, this "reserved width is too much" is not really an issue; you can try to set a negative right margin.

But if you want to show it inline or right-aligned, then the issue is that you don't know the number of  digits needed, so the negative right margin approach is not easy.
Only if you know how many digits exactly are needed, you can try to use this trick.

title: NA
body: BTW that's why I use a custom PDFPostProcessor to add the page numbering later, after BIRT created the PDF.

title: NA
body:
@speckyspooky To clarify the issue: it was discovered on BIRT 4.14 (but was probably there before) and I've also tested on BIRT 4.18 to ensure it hasn't been solved in the meantime. I confirm that the issue is still there in BIRT 4.18
The expected result would be to have the total page number right-aligned.
Thank you, @hvbtup , for your explanations. The solution is to run the report in Run + Render mode; however, we have other cases that perform better in Run and Render mode, so we need to address those issues first. Hopefully, we won't need a PDFPostProcessor, but that could serve as a last-resort solution.
I guess it won't be possible to fix the issue in BIRT so we can close it, but at least we have it documented. Thanks!

title: NA
body:
May be you can take a look into discussion #1799 there I added an example to set a small script to the "onRender()"-method for a text label to have 1 element instead of the default auto-page-numbering-grid and so it would be easy for you to set the correct layout.

This layout is more compact like the auto-grid with the 3 columns (in my point of view).

title: NA
body: It should be noted that Thomas' solution requires separate RunTask and RenderTask and does not work with a combined "RundAndRenderTask".

title: NA
body:
@speckyspooky indeed your solution looks cleaner but as mentioned by @hvbtup it requires a separate RunTask and RenderTask and the reason we are stuck with autotext is that it's the only way to get the total page numbers when running combined RunAndRenderTask. For now, we are only going to support total page numbers in our BIRT-based solution when the render task is run separately.
Thanks again both for your support.

title: DOCX emitter images shown either distorted or truncated
body:
In one of my reports, I am using an image item with the following properties:

* width: not set
* height: not set
* proportionalScale: true
* fitToContainer: true

In the `onCreate` event of the image, I set the height to 22cm:

    this.height = "22cm";

In the PDF emitter, this has the desired effect that the full image is shown and it is not distorted (the aspect ratio is intact), independent of the image's actual image dimensions (eg if it's portrait or landscape). The setting causes a maximum width of the container available width and a maximum height of 22 cm, and the image uses at most this given space.

In my case, the image is more or left quadratic, and the available width is 161.9 mm, so this is rendered with a height of ~ 161mm:
![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee404afa-8567-468b-9fbb-b15c40b635d9)


In the DOCX emitter, the effect is not as desired:
The emitter seems to ignore the combination that `proportionalScale` and `fitToContainer` are both true.
The image is rendered truncated:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/84d6e528-47b0-4610-8b3b-8bb3fc274e51)

I attempted to fix this by also setting the maximum width to 161mm in the onCreate event.
In this case, the image is shown in full (not truncated), but it is distorted:

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b151770c-892f-4fe6-b255-6c7fdb86a45f)


If you wonder, why I don't set the height property directly? Well, I have half a dozen of places in the report where an image comment can be shown. Setting the height directly causes a huge empty space in the designer, which makes editing the design a torture.

Note that the images in this report are not fixed, they are stored in the database and their dimensions can differ, some can be portrait, others landscape etc.

title: Two DOCX emitter page header issues
body:
I noticed some issues when I compared the DOCX output of my old customized DOCX emitter with the output of the DOCX emitter from master:

If `showHeaderOnFirst` is not set to `true` for the master page, then the DOCX emitter does not show the page header at all.

If I set this property to true for testing purpose, then the page header is created, but a second issue occurs:

In my test report, the content of the page header is a single dynamic text item with a border-bottom line (not a grid or whatever).
But the DOCX emitter does not create this line.

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f3b535e1-7c73-408e-a25f-baf45edcf434)

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9fc3853b-9686-4798-9890-13a9e7de8a30)

My customized emitter supported `showHeaderOnFirst`, see https://github.com/triestram-partner/birt/commit/403e3af83cf74d7d9ccc5362a1bca6f5bb6b4616

Fixing this is not  a top priority ATM. Maybe I can try to carefully create a PR from this once I find the time.

title: NA
body:
The changed behavior was added from my DOCX changes with BIRT 4.18 and the try to remove the additional formatter-grids.

This cause the effects and there are 2 effects:
1.) The bottom-line is unprinted because the layout-grid was avoid because it exists not really such style-element for docx
2.) The header-footer-height is unset because an empty grid was used to produce the correct height. This is not the right way but the solution to avoid the grid is only the first step. The docx-property of header-height/footer height must be set (currently not implemented)

Solution to get the old behavior since 4.18 & 4.19 (current version/nightly build):
- set 2 properties on report level on the "advanced property register"

![grafik](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9720ec5e-17d1-4bd1-b0e6-545a5c318db9)

With your ticket it would be better to switch the configuration from disabled (grid-usage=false) to enabled (grud-usage=true).
Please let me know.

body:
For the missing line, I did not follow your suggestion, but your suggestion gave me the idea to use a 1x1 grid, put the dynamic text item into that cell and set the border bottom property at the cell level.

I think this is a reasonable workaround: My test report is special int that it uses just a dynamic text item in the page header.
In production, the reports usually contain a grid in the page header and footer anyway.

Following your suggestion is not an option for me, if this can be only set at report level, because as you said yourself, the whole point of most of the optimizations it to avoid unneccessary nested 1x1 tables. I tried setting the UserProperty `WordEmitter.WrappedTableForMarginPadding` directly for the dynamic text item and the other setting at report level, but that did not work.

So I consider this second issue solved in a way good enought from my POV.

So only the issue regarding `showHeaderOnFirst` remains, for which a solution approach is shown in the old commit I mentioned.

title: API return html with status 200 on error
body:
The birt server API returns html error file with status 200 when pdf request fails.

Usually when a request fails a server returns status 500. BIRT just return a html file containing detailed error message which should not be visible to the user. This also make it harder to differentiate successful API call from failed API calls.


Example API call
`http://birt-server.com/birt-viewer/frameset?__report=reports/financial_report.rptdesign&__format=pdf&name=financial_report&event_id=225`

title: NA
body:
Could you please provide more details which version of BIRT you use, wich application server, java version.
The stacktrace would be great, an example image too which shows your result.

Because we have to understand your situation and your integration.
Normally the status 200 of a request means that the request was processed correctly.

body:

```
Apache Tomcat/9.0.95
jdk-17.0.12
birt-runtime-4.17.0-202409160710 (i'm using the WebViewerExample with tomcat)

```

I have deliberately generated the error by mistyping a variable name (intervention_date___).
I case of error BIRT sends html with status code 200 and also sets the response header to "text/html;charset=utf-8". 
I want to emphasize that it's not about the error message content and that it's about the fact that app returns an html response instead of status 500.


![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c8b5a3d9-ba14-41ec-a134-f4502bd33139)

title: NA
body:
This seems to be a problem with the report because
- 1st you see a standard error message from BIRT during the execution
- 2nd error means:
    Column binding "event_datetime" has referred to a data set column "intervention_date___" which does not exist.

So it seems to be a problem with column binding and the referenced parameter.
So I cannot say what the main problem is but this looks like a report topic.

title: NA
body:
@speckyspooky I think that's what the OP means: There is an error in the report, so the response status code should reflect this in their opinion.

But @alex-axiobit, please note that he BIRT WebViewer **is not a REST Web Service** and not exactly meant as an API. It is made for humans, not for computers!

title: NA
NA
body: @alex-axiobit 5xx is not the correct status for this case. Please read https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/500

title: NA
body:
Please be kind. We know very well about HTTP status codes.

Your assumption is wrong. It would be right if the WebViewer was an API.
Once again, it is not meant as such.

A 5xx status code would also be OK if the corresponding web server actually had an internal error.

From the perspective of a human using the browser to look at reports, the HTTP status codes are mostly irrelevant.
And some browsers hide important information contained in the response body or even give misleading information to the user in case of error status codes.

Regarding the fact that the output contains detailed error messages,
This is valuable information for report developers as well as for potential attackers.

A pull request which makes this behavior configurable via a System property would be welcome.
The property should use a safe setting by default, but the full info should be visible when the WebViewer is run as part of the BIRT designer.

If you still think that the HTTP status code should be changed, please create a PR.
Personally, I am -0 for changing it here, but I would not object.

However, if you want to specify and implement an actual REST API, now *that* would be a great contribution!

title: BIRT 4.18 implementation of log4j
body:
I have used the runtime version of  BIRT to build my application WAR file for 10-plus years, I have not had a problem. However, with version 4.18 the added jar file called org.apache.logging.log4j.to.slf4j_2.24.1 is causing my log4j configuration file to not load. My logging goes to Tomcat stderr instead of my designated file. Nonetheless, if I delete that jar file my application loads correctly:

2025-02-07T16:39:26.838223200Z main INFO LoggerContext[name=Copyright (c) 2006-2025 U2logic, Inc. All Rights Reserved.] started with configuration XmlConfiguration[location=C:\Program Files\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat 9.0\webapps\U2WebLink\conf\log4j2.xml, lastModified=2022-04-01T05:26:34Z].

Otherwise, in the standard BIRT 4.18 library I get this:

2025-02-07T16:59:45.730819Z main INFO LoggerContext[name=Copyright (c) 2006-2024 U2logic, Inc. All Rights Reserved.] started with configuration XmlConfiguration[location=C:\Program Files\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat 9.0\webapps\U2logic\conf\log4j2.xml, lastModified=2022-04-01T05:26:34Z].
2025-02-07T17:00:00.068910600Z main ERROR LogManager returned an instance of org.apache.logging.slf4j.SLF4JLoggerContextFactory which does not implement org.apache.logging.log4j.core.impl.Log4jContextFactory. Unable to initialize Log4j.

title: NA
body:
There are just way too many logging frameworks and I've wasted to very much time because of that.  😱 

The dependency was added to resolve this problem:

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/commit/4070b04803451ae9e2e296cff329d406e09cfe33

Perhaps there are other solutions, e.g., maybe using org.apache.logging.log4j.slf4j2.impl instead.  But I'm reluctant to make changes with a risk of regression to accommodate a problem reported by a single person.  Perhaps you just need to update/grade your log4j configuration to accommodate newer versions...

title: XLSX, IllegalStateException: "Cannot add merged region" after upgrade from Birt 4.8.0 to Birt 4.18
body:
Hello,

I upgraded from Birt 4.8.0 to Birt 4.14 (at the same time going from Java 11 to Java 21) and I have this error on some of my XLS reports : 

`java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot add merged region B31:B32 to sheet because it overlaps with an existing merged region (A32:I32).
        at org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFSheet.validateMergedRegions(HSSFSheet.java:789)
        at org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFSheet.addMergedRegion(HSSFSheet.java:737)
        at org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFSheet.addMergedRegion(HSSFSheet.java:680)
        at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.StyleManagerUtils.extendRows(StyleManagerUtils.java:1329)
        at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.handlers.AbstractRealTableRowHandler.interruptRow(AbstractRealTableRowHandler.java:233)
        at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.handlers.AbstractRealTableRowHandler.endRow(AbstractRealTableRowHandler.java:80)
        at uk.co.spudsoft.birt.emitters.excel.ExcelEmitter.endRow(ExcelEmitter.java:477)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.CompositeContentEmitter.endRow(CompositeContentEmitter.java:168)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLTableLayoutEmitter.endRow(HTMLTableLayoutEmitter.java:607)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.emitter.ContentEmitterUtil.endContent(ContentEmitterUtil.java:127)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.AbstractNode.end(AbstractNode.java:65)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.HTMLPageBuffer.endRow(HTMLPageBuffer.java:167)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.HTMLPageBuffer.endContainer(HTMLPageBuffer.java:125)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.buffer.TableBreakBuffer.endContainer(TableBreakBuffer.java:281)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLStackingLM.end(HTMLStackingLM.java:39)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLAbstractLM.layout(HTMLAbstractLM.java:134)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLBlockStackingLM.layoutNodes(HTMLBlockStackingLM.java:66)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLStackingLM.layoutChildren(HTMLStackingLM.java:27)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLRepeatHeaderLM.layoutChildren(HTMLRepeatHeaderLM.java:54)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLAbstractLM.layout(HTMLAbstractLM.java:133)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLBlockStackingLM.layoutNodes(HTMLBlockStackingLM.java:66)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLPageLM.layout(HTMLPageLM.java:92)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLReportLayoutEngine.layout(HTMLReportLayoutEngine.java:97)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RunAndRenderTask.doRun(RunAndRenderTask.java:145)
        at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RunAndRenderTask.run(RunAndRenderTask.java:69)
		...`

Today I did a new upgrade toward Birt 4.18 just in case but the same error happens...
The error did not happen before with Birt 4.8.0.

Could you please help me resolve this issue ?

Best regards

title: NA
body:
You could help solve the problem:

https://github.com/eclipse-birt/birt/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

Minimally you need to help someone else reproduce the problem so that someone else can fix it for you.

title: NA
body:
This is a situation cause through the report and merged cells.

The report has 2 cell merges:
- merge 01: cell area B31:B32
- merge 02: cell area A32:I32

The result is that the excel emitter tries to merge region B31:B32 twice which is not possible.
The excel API avoid double merge regions and overlapping.

So it would be important to check the report and investigate there.
We can only support you if we would get an example report without external references/resources.

title: NA
body:
Hello @speckyspooky , @merks ,

Here is an example report, 
I tried to remove everything not necessary / confidential and leave only the necessary to produce the error.
Still it need a database connection, I did not know how to simulate this...

Working with Birt 4.8.0 and not with Birt 4.18

[test.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18749570/test.txt)

Thank you for your help

title: NA
body:
I have checked your report and changed the data source to the classic cars model (integrated BIRT data model). I ahe the report added.

The core reason is given through the following conditions in your report:
1. structure table in a table / grid in grid - excel makes no difference between grid / table
2. merged group cell of the inner table
3. changed API which creates the excel files

The BIRT 4.8 integrated an old version of the excel creator engine (Apache POI) and there were 2 different ways given to create excel (xls-own type, xlsx-own type).
With the updates of the excel API through Apache the excel engine was changed to use the same behavior for xls & xlsx (merged 2 types to 1 type) only the final format is different.

This is the reason why xls was working with 4.8 but not with 4.18. I have tested xlsx and this got the error with both versions.

You have 2 solutions to solve the problem:
1. avoid the merge of the grouping-footer
2. acoid the grid around the table and use directly the table without grid to have only 1 table

I hope this can help you to solve your topic.

[test.txt-classic-cars.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18757989/test.txt-classic-cars.zip)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29e2d44c-d4e7-49e4-bd67-23fee20eefe3)

title: NA
body:
Thank you for your analysis @speckyspooky 
You confirm this is not something that can/should be fixed on Birt side ?

I guess we will have to change our reports to avoid this kind of structure that trigger the error,
The thing is that we have more than 90 of them...

title: NA
body:
Please be aware you migrate from BIRT 4.8 to BIRT 4.18 and 4.8 was published 2018.
So yes, the used APIs will be optimized from this history point.

And we doesn't talk about a bug this is the standrad of the current excel-api.
Please try to think you try to print in an excel cell an additional table and then with merges.

title: NA
body:
**Best practice**
The best way yes is to optimize your report layouts and avoid tabel in table for excel.

**Workaround**
If you use the BIRT-preview and create afterwards the excel then you didn't get the error.
Because the generated preview (HTML) will be used like an intermediate format which tries to handle your tabel-in-table.
If you have BIRT integrated into your software you would need a seperat Run-Task and Render-Task then you have se same effect.

(If you start excel from designer directly a RundAndRender-task will be used without the HTML-converting.)

Please be aware there is no gurantee that this way will work for all of your reports because the may problem is still into your report which means table-in-table is not a good solution for excel generation.
So from my point of view I would optimize the reports step by step.

And the answer to your question, this behavior cannot be changed throuh a BIRT optimization.
There are so many options possible like table-in-table-in-table-in-table which works for PDF but never for excel.

title: Utility, converting for dimensions doesn't support standard calculation of "px" to different units
body:
Based on the change of  #2050 I figured out that the DimensionUtil hasn't any calculation option to calculate pixel to other units.
So it would be good to have a standard implementation to calculate different units based on pixel "px" and the standard resolution (96 dpi).

I will create a change for the unit converting incl. test cases.
